items.content:
Oodls works with Instagrammers, brands and companies all over the world to provide awesome user-generated content.This is an opportunity to get in on the ground floor and really make your mark at one of Scotland's most exciting tech start-ups.

We're looking for someone who's a passionate sales leader, with an enviable collection of media contacts they can bring to the table. You will lead a small team to achieve challenging targets, and have a key role in advising on product refinements. You’ll need to be passionate about mucking in and leading by example, making sales from the get go and getting out there meeting and converting prospects.

We’re not necessarily looking for someone with a stock photography background, but you will need to have extensive experience of selling to agencies and media businesses, preferably SaaS.

This can be a remote working role with a requirement to be in the office (Edinburgh) approx once per month or when required. Being in London would be advantageous.

Devising strategies for driving sales growth across the business.
• Analysing existing approaches to the development of business and making changes where appropriate.
• Interviewing and hiring new members of the business development team.
• Implementing new business initiatives across the company
• Generate new business within large accounts.
• Identifying sales opportunities as a result of market changes.
• Setting up meetings with prospective customers to sell the company’s products and services.
• Working with the CEO to implement sales incentives to drive sales performance within the team.
• Acting as a key contact for large customer accounts.
• Forming strategic partnerships with other companies to leverage theirexisting networks.
• Working with the CEO to set achievable revenue targets for the business development managers.
• Negotiating sales contracts with customers and ensuring their profitability.
• Working with the marketing team to devise marketing materials and tools to support new business.
• Monitoring customer satisfaction with existing clients to ensure service delivery.
• Working with the CEO to advise on pricing strategies and opportunities for product diversification

items.title: Almabase: Sales Development Representative
items.content:
Sales Development Representative

We are looking for an entrepreneurial, ambitious Sales Development Representative to help to build a pipeline for our sales team to support significant revenue growth. Success in this role will enable you to advance your sales career rapidly. 
 
This is a full-time, 100% remote position. This position comes with a very good base salary plus generous commissions and medical insurance.
 

As a SDR at Almabase, you will
  • Bring a world-class solution to market and function as the initial face of Almabase.
  • Generate sales qualified opportunities to fuel Almabase’s growth, primarily through phone and email. 
  • Plan the outreach - segmentation, setting up sequences, messaging etc. We have a research team who will provide targeted lists, so you will not have to spend any time on that!
  • There is also a content team dedicated to supporting outbound efforts. They will help you with case studies, educational content, newsletters, etc. 
  • Reach out to 100 schools per week .

About you
  • You have some experience as an SDR (both email and phone prospecting).
  • Passion, enthusiasm, humor, and the ability to convey this through phone and email communications.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills; organized and detail-oriented.
  • You have a bias towards immediate action and results.
  • Focused on hitting weekly and monthly targets with a demonstrated track record.
  • You are living in the USA or Canada.

items.title: Advisor - Identity and Data Management (IDM) - NE Region - Remote
items.content:
Company Description

At Optiv, were on a mission to help our clients make their businesses more secure. Were one of the fastest growing companies in a truly essential industry.

In your role at Optiv, youll be inspired by a team of the brightest business and technical minds in cyber security. We are passionate champions for our clients, and know from experience that the best solutions for our clients needs come from working hard together. As part of our team, your voice matters, and you will do important work that has impact, on people, businesses and nations. Our industry and our company move fast, and you can be sure that you will always have room to learn and grow. Were proud of our team and the important work we do to build confidence for a more connected world.

Job Description

Who we are looking for:

Accomplished cyber security professional with a distinguished background in Identity and Data Management (IDM) as a practitioner who has also demonstrated tangible success in securing initial business as well as developing new business opportunities. The Advisor combines strategy and technical knowledge with sales skills and applies practical cyber security experience to formulate meaningful solutions that address the strategic needs of clients and effectively communicate that shared vision by, producing proposals and acting as the subject matter expert in IDM strategy across multiple customers.

The Advisor provides a consultative sales approach by leveraging their experience from delivering and overseeing complex engagements in IDM to effectively develop and articulate solutions to customers, and present in well-constructed proposals that comprehensively and clearly defines the outcomes, approach, and delivery model.

How youll make an impact:
  • Provide pre-sales support in collaboration with our sales team and ensure product and service selection meets customers business and technology needs
  • Achieve expert-level knowledge in multiple IDM solution areas and be able timely and effectively translate client needs into actionable Statements of Work for Optivs strategic offerings
  • Identify and understand our client's security concerns and how they correlate to Optivs strategic IDM solutions across the IDM pillars and compliment holistic cyber security programs
  • Assist in identifying additional Optiv capabilities that the client may find beneficial
#LI-SM1
Qualifications
  • 6+ Experience in providing guidance in IDM strategy at a programmatic level
  • Manage and prioritize the proposal process to create SOWs and respond to RFI/RFPs
  • Ability to clearly articulate the benefits of your Optiv subject matter product and service solutions portfolio to various client stakeholders
  • Proven experience in a pre-sales, post-sales, or non-sales technical capacity in an information security environment.
  • Ability to listen and communicate effectively with vendors, prospects, clients, account managers and management.
  • Confident presentation, written, and oral communication skills
  • Desire to learn additional subject matter areas
Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

items.title: Travel Outlook: Immediate Interviews, Start on Aug 12th: Hospitality Sales and Service ...
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Immediate Interviews, Start on Aug 12th: Hospitality Sales and Service Reservation Specialist for Boutique Hotels & Resorts (AM-MID-PM Options)

OVERVIEW

“Unlike any other Virtual Call Center…” 

“A Company That Cares About Its Employees…” 
 
Our clients include some of the most well-known and highest rated Hotels. We take our responsibility to providing their guests with a VIP experience very seriously.

This is how our present employees describe working with us at Travel Outlook. 

We are looking for passionate and dedicated people willing to start at the ground level with us as a virtual  Reservation Specialist . You will be an integral addition to our team as we continue our tremendous growth and maturity into the leading Virtual Hospitality Company. 

Our team members have the amazing opportunity to better balance home, parenting, school and work schedules to fit their lifestyle working in our 100% work from home -based company. 

You would work from a suitable home office space, receiving incoming reservation calls that are routed to you by our sophisticated contact center phone system. 

This opportunity is for Full-Time Permanent (40 hours per week) working either an AM, MID or PM schedule. All schedules will include working Saturday and Sunday, for at least the first six months of employment.

 
The starting rate of pay is $11.00 per hour with easily attained increases to $14.00 within 6 months.

TRAINING
 

Mandatory paid training is three weeks Mon-Fri between the hours of 9:00am-6:00pm EST, from 8/05-8/30. Attendance for all 15 days of training is mandatory and there are no exceptions.

 
During this training you will learn about Travel Outlook, the Hotel industry, our award-winning sales Technique KQL and the various technologies employed that make us the industry leading Central Reservation Office service.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
·         Must be able to operate a phone headset, computer and company's software.
·         Must maintain a home workspace that is free from outside noise and distractions.
·         Must be able to speak and hear clearly to effectively communicate with each caller.
·         Must be on time and ready to take calls for every scheduled shift in compliance with policy.
·         Must be able to efficiently type accurate, professional messages summarizing caller needs.
·         Must display genuine friendly, engaging and helpful personality, on and off the phone.
·         Must understand and act in accordance with Travel Outlook's Core Values and Policies.
 
WHAT YOU NEED TO GET STARTED IN OUR NEXT NEW HIRE CLASS
·         A positive attitude and great relationship building skills.
·         Experience of two (2) years in Customer Service or Sales in a call center.
·         A home computer with a Windows Operating System 8.1 or 10.
·         A wired high-speed internet connection (25MB downstream/5MB upstream).
·         A USB headset will be provided by us.
·         A quiet distraction-free work environment (with a door).

MORE INFORMATION

How to get an Interview?
Please follow the apply URL to our Technical Compatibility Assessment page. Upon successful completion and confirmation that your home network meets our requirements you will be scheduled for an interview within 1-2 business days.  

Check us out on Glassdoor.
https://www.glassdoor.com/Overview/Working-at-Travel-Outlook-EI_IE767086.11,25.htm 

What states we are presently hiring in?
We are currently looking specifically for applicants in one of the following 21 states: 

Arizona, Colorado, Florida, Georgia, Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Louisiana, Maine, Maryland, Mississippi, Nebraska, New Mexico, North Carolina, Pennsylvania, South Carolina, South Dakota, Tennessee, Texas, Vermont and Virginia.

items.content:
Business Insights Advisor at CVS Health

Remote

Job ID: 1052221BR

Location: OH – CINCINNATI

RI – Lincoln

OH – WORK FROM HOME

RI – WORK FROM HOME

Street Address: 900 Omnicare Center

Category:Finance|Analytics|Omnicare

Job Description
As an Advisor within the Omnicare Business Insights and Data Infrastructure Team, this colleague will be responsible for the development and delivery of multiple key analytic and reporting work streams and projects within the LTC Omnicare portfolio.

This role will require collaboration with business end users, project stakeholders, and IT partners to identify needs, goals, metric measurements, and business facing data views resulting in clear interfaces enabling end users to quickly identify key themes within the business.
Strong analytic skills and ability to develop, and implement analytical data models, dashboard and reports using Tableau and similar tools enabling end users to analyze data and make informed business decisions. Proven history of utilizing Business Intelligence applications and products to develop executive dashboards and operational scorecards will be beneficial.

Responsibilities

  • Analytical Support of Projects within the Business Insights and Data Infrastructure Portfolio –
    • Design and productionize of analytics and reporting of the Omnicare portfolio (includes predictive analytics and developing the metrics and measures for each project).
  • Develop New Metrics and Automated/Sustainable Reporting
    • Ability to transform data attributes into meaningful accurate metrics. Utilize tools and knowledge to develop final reporting in an automated or scalable fashion utilizing a variety of tools. (ie. Oracle, SAS, Power Query, Power Pivot…etc)
  • Establishing Source Data Requirements
    • Ability to clearly articulate the required data elements, formatting, frequency, structure, etc. of the IT components supporting all reporting elements.
  • Leadership Updates & Alignment – influence and advise senior leaders based on the metrics, trends and resource plan.

This ideal candidate can reside anywhere in the US as this position can work remotely.

Required Qualifications
Must have a minimum of 4 years analytical experience and/or education equivalent

Preferred Qualifications

  • Strong ability to manage multiple complex tasks with confidence & accuracy
  • Experience in developing reporting, aggregating data and providing key insights through metrics
  • Proficient/Mastery in MS Excel, Word, and Power Point
  • Intermediate knowledge of SQL
  • Hands-on experience/expertise in data management tools, such as SAS, Python, SQL and BI tools such as Microstrategy
  • Familiarity with different database management systems (Oracle, DB2, MySQL)
  • Experience with ETL layer dynamics and process
  • Experience with rapid prototyping and proof of concept
  • Excellent problem solving skills and ability to construct analytic solutions to business problems
  • Demonstrated success dealing with ambiguity or uncertainty and ability to learn on the fly to understand and solve new problems
  • Ability to communicate effectively in a manner that is clear, logical and concise
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, including the ability to interact and influence peers and operational partners

Education

  • Bachelors degree in Finance, Data Analytics, Management Information Systems or related field required
  • Preferred: Masters degree in related field or MBA preferred.
Apply for job

items.title: Business Development Associate
items.content:
DESCRIPTION

One of the UK’s leading PropTech scale-ups, changing the face of commercial property. Our mission is to find the perfect home for every company and we’ve built an online platform to help businesses rent, manage and share office space in London. We’ve raised over £6m in venture funding from the most respected investors in technology and real estate to make this mission a reality.

As a Business Development Associate you will be tasked with reaching out to and engaging with a wide variety of businesses in London and beyond, to help drive awareness of Hubble. You will have direct contact with new and existing clients, interacting through email, social channels, and on the phone.

You should be willing to get stuck in, with a very hands-on approach and be self motivated to work in a brand new team, in a fast-paced, constantly changing environment.

You will operate at the heart of a fast growing startup and will therefore have plenty of opportunity to learn and contribute beyond your core role. You will gain a wealth of experience in this role, and will have a real opportunity to grow and develop in your career.


RESPONSIBILITIES

Research and identify prospects throughout London.
Pitch potential clients on the benefits of working with Hubble, help them understand the ever-changing office market, and guide them towards Hubble when they start to search for a new office.
Develop new outbound campaign ideas, and test different approaches.
Manage and track pipeline, strategically prioritising your efforts to maximise results.
Be able to talk confidently about the London office market.
Incorporate the Hubble tone of voice into your communication.
Work closely with other teams within Hubble and get stuck in where required.
Take an active role in promoting and communicating Hubble’s values and mission.
Hit targets!


REQUIREMENTS

Energetic, passionate, and driven individual who can easily collaborate with others.
Sensitive to varied customer personalities and needs.
At ease when communicating with others, whether that’s via email, phone or face to face.
Technology savvy and willing to learn new tools.
Hungry to learn and grow professionally.
Conscientious, with excellent attention to detail.
Analytical approach to problem solving.
Highly organised.
Strong work ethic and sense of ownership.
Comfortable taking initiative, suggesting improvements and making decisions independent of others.
No specific industry experience required.


BENEFITS

We make sure everyone in the team is comfortable and has the best environment for them. We offer flexible hours, remote working and have a relaxed attitude to taking holiday - focusing only on whether work gets done. Benefits can be tweaked on an individual basis depending on what makes you most productive. Here are some of the things we offer:

Remuneration competitive with industry and level of experience.
Macbook, peripherals and standing desk.
Expense budget & travel.
Noise-cancelling headphones.
Spotify Premium or Apple Music.
Kindle Unlimited + free technical books.
Health & Pension.
Cycle to Work scheme.

Hubble is an equal opportunities employer. We are a diverse bunch of people who are committed to maintaining a welcoming culture of inclusion and equality. We encourage applications from anyone that meets the requirements for the role.

items.title: Manager Sales - Santa Clara/San Benito County - Remote - PS20019
items.content:
Manager Sales - Santa Clara/San Benito County - Remote - PS20019

Location: California, United States

Requisition #: PS20019

Post Date: Jun 11, 2019

Your Talent. Our Vision. At CareMore , a proud member of the Anthem, Inc. family of companies specializing in providing senior Americans a complete and pro-active health care experience, its a powerful combination. Its the foundation upon which were creating greater access to care for our members, greater value for our customers and greater health for our communities. Join us and together we will drive the future of health care .

This is an exceptional opportunity to do innovative work that means more to you and those we serve.

Location : This is a Work-At-Home position. Will be responsible for the Santa Clara/San Benito territory. Therefore the selected candidate must live in the Santa Clara/San Benito area.

Manager Sales / Mgr I CareMore Sales

Responsible for managing the CareMore field sales team. This includes directing, monitoring and coaching staff to ensure all CMS guidelines, State, Federal and Corporate regulations are met at all times. Primary duties may include, but are not limited to:

  • Managing Local Sales Team and ensure all sales objectives are met.

  • Monitor market performance and assesses competitive landscape within assigned market area.

  • Partner with Regional Performance Manager and be knowledgeable about providers contracted with CareMore.

  • Represent CareMore at community/employer/company-sponsored events to promote the company, raise awareness and generate leads.

  • Record, report and maintain lead disposition status using appropriate tools.

  • Hires, trains, coaches, counsels, and evaluates performance of direct reports.

Requires 2 years of sales management experience with 2-5 years of experience selling Medicare Advantage products or similar. Preferred BA/BS or AA/AS and bilingual Spanish/English, or Vietnamese/English. An active Accident/Health/Life License is required. Must reside in the Santa Clara/San Benito County. For CareMore business units, satisfactory completion of a pre-placement Tuberculosis test is a requirement for this position.

Anthem, Inc. is ranked as one of Americas Most Admired Companies among health insurers by Fortune magazine and is a 2018 DiversityInc magazine Top 50 Company for Diversity. To learn more about our company and apply, please visit us at careers.antheminc.com. An Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veteran.

Our top sales representative grossed over $100,000 in sales in just three months and never left her home. If you want to be paid for your efforts and have the support of a corporate office but the flexibility of being self-employed, apply today.

At CBD BioCare, our mission is to educate about the healing powers of hemp and to get this product in the hands of those who need it the most. In order to accomplish this goal, we need people like you. If you are ready to make a change and be part of the fastest growing industry in the nation, then apply to learn more.

Here is what our sales representative program has to offer:

Ability to manage your own sales with a comprehensive dashboard to track and monitor your business.

Control your own schedule and earning potential.

Receive sales training and marketing materials.

Carry no sales inventory to hold or deliver.

The opportunity to earn referral fees (we are not a multi-level marketing company).

Associate with people who share your passion to educate about CBD.

Forbes Magazine estimates the CBD industry will grow to 2.1 billion dollars by 2020, that s up 700% from 2016. Are you ready to be one of the first to take advantage of this unique opportunity?

CBD companies are not equal--we offer full spectrum CBD, organically grown and manufactured in the USA at FDA approved facilities. We offer third party testing and company transparency.

We are not just selling CBD, we are building a CBD BioCare community, changing lives one bottle at a time.

Ready to take the next step? Apply TODAY!

items.content:
Account Manager

Air Agents is a fast-growing start-up company, with BIG plans for the future. As the UK’s most loved management company for hosts on Airbnb, our trusted team deliver an exceptional service to both our guests and hosts alike.

After receiving further investment (we’re already backed by investors, including 2 stars from the popular Dragon’s Den show!) we are now looking to build on our success and scale ourselves into a truly global and market-leading company.

To help us achieve our goal, we are looking for passionate individuals, with a genuine desire to be part of our fast-paced, ever-changing business. Could you be our next superstar?

What is the Account Manager role?
We’re on the hunt for an experienced Account Manager to help us provide an exceptional experience for our current corporate hosts and to help grow our client base.
You’ll be based at our offices in Hammersmith but will enjoy visiting our corporate clients and their properties as required.
The salary for this role is negotiable based on experience, and also comes with a range of benefits.

What will I be responsible for?
You’ll deal directly with our corporate hosts on a daily basis, helping them from start to end of the hosting and management process. You’ll become their designated point of contact, a real ambassador for Air Agents, helping with all aspects of the process.
This will involve, but is not limited to;
• Facilitating regular update meetings
• Managing the availability and revenue generated from each property and client
• Encouraging clients to add more properties
• Delivering feedback from guests
• Providing timely Management Information to the board

What skills and experience do I need?
To be considered you’ll need to be Degree qualified and have demonstrable experience in a corporate Account Management role (2 years +).
We’ll also need you to;
• Demonstrate super presentation skills
• Demonstrate exceptional customer service skills (both remotely and face-to-face)
• Demonstrate excellent organisation and efficiency in everything that you do
• Have a working-knowledge of Customer Relationship Management tools (HubSpot is chosen CRM)
• Have experience of creating and presenting Management Information reports
• Be super-proficient in the use of computer applications such as the Google and Microsoft suite of products*
*At the core of our business is our technology, and there’s lots of it! Ideally therefore, you should also be keen and able to learn new tools and techniques quickly.

Of utmost importance, however, is that you have a genuine entrepreneurial spirit, can provide superior customer service, and that you like paying significant attention to detail. We’d also love for you to have a good appreciation of start-up companies and understand what it means to be a successful company.

What are you waiting for? If you’d like to be considered for this exciting opportunity then please do get in touch, providing your CV and an accompanying document telling us how you can be our next superstar.

items.title: Business Consultant - Insurance - Remote Working - Technology
items.content:
Synchro are proud to be partnering with a renowned technology and data analytics powerhouse and are recruiting exclusively on their behalf for a client facing Business Consultant with claims insurance experience to join the team.

As the Business Consultant you will be responsible for the end to end implementation of a sophisticated and highly sought-after SaaS product suite. This product suite will be delivered into the insurance market; therefore, it is vital you have experience of this sector. You will have overall day-to-day management of multiple implementation projects for new and existing customers within an agreed project schedule and scope and have the flexibility to work from wherever you want. This could be at home, in the office in Sheffield or perhaps a shared office space (this would be paid for).

We are seeking a Business Consultant who would enjoy being involved in wearing multiple hats and would relish the opportunity of traveling throughout the UK to client site, working remotely and freely and on occasion perhaps an international trip away for a couple of days. Our client is on a mission to grow their market share not just in the U.K but also in EMEA.

Other core responsibilities will consist of:

  • Supporting presales
  • Delivering demo's and presentations
  • Requirements capture as well as analysing and documenting client needs
  • Configuration and Implementation of the solution
  • Project management duties
  • Training when required on the product suite

To be considered for the role you will either be a client facing software consultant or an experienced professional with a strong background in insurance. Perhaps operational, supply chain or advisory. The core skills we are looking for are:

  • Background in Claims Insurance
  • Stakeholder management
  • Ability to capture requirements
  • Ability to manage multiple projects at any one time
  • Ability to control a room
  • An interest in solution selling and somebody who would relish being client facing
  • Happy to travel
  • You do not need to understand SaaS or technology. However, an interest in technology would definitely help!

You will be joining a close knit and supportive team consisting of mixed experience and you will have the opportunity to grow across the business.

ROLE: Business Consultant

LOCATION: Remote working

SALARY: Up to £55,000

BENEFITS: 25 days of annual leave, pension scheme, corporate credit card, flexible working environment, working within a collaborative business.

Please contact Ryan James at Synchro to explore this exclusive opportunity further or apply through this job posting and we will be in touch.

items.title: Business Development Manager
items.content:
*About Us*
SCOPE Procurement Solutions is a young tech-start-up in the construction industry. We provide an online B2B platform for the procurement of professional services, such as architects, engineers, quantity surveyors and project managers.

SCOPE is pioneering in this market in the UK and our goal is to revolutionize construction procurement on a global basis, making markets more transparent and supply chains more efficient.

Targeting rapid growth in this sector, we are now looking for a Business Development Manager to play a key role in generating new business leads.


*Your Skills and Experience*
As Business Development Manager, you will have proven experience in securing business in the construction sector and as such will be highly connected within the industry. You should have a good understanding of construction projects and related procurement processes. You will display passion and inspire confidence in those around you encouraging a strong team ethic.

Key requirements for this role are:
* At least 2-3 years of business sales experience
* Very strong network in the construction industry, especially property developers, project managers and quantity surveyors
* Experience in using different client-acquisition methods, including telephone and email sales, online platforms such as LinkedIn and face-to-face meetings, e.g. at networking events
* A first-class track record of sales performance, excellent rapport building, negotiation and communication skills
* Experience of using a CRM system
* An aptitude for working towards targets and deadlines and devising a personal strategy to hit and exceed them
* A friendly, outgoing personality who enjoys working in teams


*Responsibilities of the Business Development Manager*
The Business Development Manager will be an exciting role with flexible hours (full and part-time both possible) and a considerable impact SCOPE’s success. You will be responsible for identifying opportunities and managing client relationships across the UK and potentially worldwide.

As part of your role, you will develop a wide and close network of client relationships to generate and maintain business. You will be responsible for establishing a company sales strategy as well as building and managing SCOPE’s business development department as the company grows.

Key responsibilities include:
* Generating new business across all allocated products and territories and promote repeat sales
* Cold calling and messaging to generate new business as well as converting warm leads
* Effectively maintaining the CRM system
* Be the face of SCOPE by attending conferences and conducting client meetings
* Closely managing existing customers, offering online and face-to-face support
* Create and implement a sales strategy for products and territories to meet sales targets
* Mentor more junior members of the team


*Our Benefits*
At SCOPE, we believe that a positive work culture is essential to promote business success. This is why we offer all our employees a wide range of great benefits, including:
* Exceptional *opportunities to grow* within a young tech-start-up
* Fully *commission-based salary* with immense upside potential (no base salary can be offered initially but an option including a base salary will be offered as soon as sufficient business has been generated)
* Additional performance-based *bonuses*
* *Flexible workplace* culture, allowing you to work from anywhere
* *Flexible working hours*, working around our clients’ schedules
* Generous allowance of *30 holidays*
* *Many more* benefits as the business grows (e.g. cycle to work scheme, private health insurance, 13th salary etc etc)
* And most importantly, the exciting opportunity to be part of a *young innovative company’s* journey, being a key person with *huge impact* on the business’ success and having a great time within a *small but growing team* of passionate, driven people.


*Be Part of the Story*
We encourage a diverse workforce and inclusive workplace, and welcome applications from different backgrounds. Just click the Apply button to submit your application.

items.content:
Hi. I’m Eric and I’m the Co-Founder & CTO of Itoma 3D Tech. We are a start-up based in Hatfield / North London, UK.

Our Vision is to simplify 3D Modelling & 3D Printing using AI, Robotics & Voice technology to make it at our customer's voice command.
Big Vision starts with a single niche to make us investable, find a market fit & develop a product so we currently focus on 3D Modelling & 3D Printing for B2B Architecture & Construction and that's the market where we currently develop co-venturing & sales relationships.

This is our product roadmap to get us there:
itoma.co.uk/3dme-product-demo/
And that’s our long-term strategy:
itoma.co.uk/our-3d-tech-strategy/

We have pre-seed funding, well defined plan & an amazing tech team to get an edge, MVP, first sales, a couple of Letters of Intent, cooperation for innovation with 2 universities, received SEIS & EIS status for UK investors and currently focus on fundraising & sales.



WHAT:
We are looking for a person with some sales experience & drive to join our start-up on a flexible, part-time basis for equity with sales commission:
1. To finish the development of our sales strategy (Mostly B2B to architecture & construction).
2. Continue contacting leads & develop customer sales strategy.
3. Get Letters of Intent & sales to help us get funding & develop the product line.

Then once we develop sufficiently – to join us full or part-time as a salaried person or continue as an advisor:
1. To move to contract stages with B2B sales.
2. Develop relationships with new customers.
3. And build the proper sales team to eventually manage.



PROPOSED IMPACT JD:
1 month - pick up relationship with existing companies that we met & contacted.
2 months - 1 Letter of Intent
3 months - first sales
6 months - 1 co-venturing relationship for market fit & product development. Multiple sales.
12 months - 2 co-venturing relationships (in total). Sales volumes. Thinking of international possibilities (initially - for prestige to investors for Series A).



WHO:
We trust that will suit best someone who is already working part-time in sales and looks for the long term but a flexible game with an innovative start-up.
Or someone who recently retired or semi-retired and wants to get back in the game (even constant holidays get finally boring after ~1 year of constant travelling – we have an example in our team already!).



YOUR MOTIVATION:
Your motivation is more important than a perfect experience. We offer flexibility (eg. home based & set your own hours as long as we all get to our impact goals), support and a product that can take practically any shape, size & colour in exchange (to make it this much easier)
The possibility to shape the Future is a bonus!



You know what they say – set the expectations early but don’t scare everyone off!
In other words – we are all people so even if you fulfil some of this stuff but eg. have a passion for 3D Printing, Architecture & Construction & innovative tech – then give us a shout.
But most of all - we are a start-up so the main thing is that we are in it together & like us here - you do not expect salary straight away because we simply can't afford it yet but we will offer commission on sales with equity, which can especially pay off if you've got good contacts in Construction & Architecture industry.


Best,
Eric


PS Good start is crucial – we sign a mutual NDA with all people who work with us to have a good & open conversation & then have a couple of conversations to build the big picture of where we are going as well as sales plan.

items.title: Regional Sales Manager
items.content:
This is a unique opportunity to impact every renter in the UK through exciting and highly rewarding work.

Join us on our mission to create a world of deposit FREE renting!

We expect more people to rent than ever before. That’s why we believe renting should be more affordable and accessible. We are a young and innovative startup solving an affordability problem by offering deposit-free renting to millions of tenants across the UK - with lots more exciting stuff to come.

We have built a core team and a product we are proud of, raised significant seed capital and partnered with the UK's largest independent letting agency. Plus, we’re currently working with the world’s largest institutional landlord so we’re well on our way to driving the renting revolution!

As a Regional Sales Manager, you will work in the northern regions of the UK to help flatfair meet its ambitious growth targets (although we'd want to see you in the London HQ once or twice a month!). This field-based role needs an experienced, go-getting sales dynamo to drive innovation, growing flatfair through strategic partnerships and representing the brand as we continue to scale across the UK and further afield.


Focus of the role?

Identifying, attracting, negotiating and launching partnerships with a variety of landlords, property managers and letting agents, both public and private, in the area of Northern England and Scotland
Manage full life cycle, from initial outreach, through onboarding to relationship management
Account manage existing relationships in the region, optimising our partnerships and identifying future opportunities
Focus on providing an outstanding sales experience to flatfair's potential partners, effectively communicating our vision and platform, and building a greater network within the industry
Being an ongoing thought partner for agencies, partners and suppliers by leading on strategic initiatives and high level planning
Identify marketing, event and networking opportunities for flatfair to attend/sponsor or speak at
Be able to deliver a perfect elevator pitch over the phone and in person as well as writing carefully crafted emails
Effectively collaborate remotely between the London based HQ account management, business development and tech team to ensure all customers enjoy the full flatfair experience.


Who are you?

Experienced working within the property industry, maybe in proptech or online
Driven by closing new business, you'll love the thrill of discovering what makes potential customers tick and communicating how flatfair can support them
Excited about the idea of working autonomously to contribute to the growth of a fast-scaling startup, preferably with exciting memories of times you were in one before
Ability to speak and write in English fluently and idiomatically
A car owner, you'll be willing to travel across the north and Scotland


What’s in it for you:

Uncapped commission: This role is all about growth, and we want to incentivise you to succeed. With a competitive basic salary and generous uncapped commission, as well as travel expenses, you'll be looked after
Flexibility: We want you to be your own leader and encourage an autonomous and flexible work style right across the business
Socials: We like to bring everyone together for a weekly team lunch, regular social events and get-togethers in a fully stocked kitchen with snacks, fruits and drinks (and you’d get to lead on organising them!)
Holiday: 25 days holiday a year (plus UK public holidays), and we encourage you to use them all up!
Learning and training: We’ll contribute towards training courses and conferences that help you learn and grow professionally and personally
Personal development: Following a motivating career path, we value growth from within and encourage people to step up

--

Note to agencies and third parties: we have a team who owns all of our talent processes at the moment and are happy with how we’re growing. We love your enthusiasm to work with us, but we’re not looking for new partners currently so please hold off on cold-calling us for now.

items.title: Account Management Intern
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=8, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
We are GuestReady – a globally leading short-term rental management company, which provides professional services to property investors, homeowners and Airbnb hosts in London, Paris, Kuala Lumpur, Hong Kong, Lisbon, Porto and Dubai. Our mission is to leverage new technologies to unlock the full potential of real estate worldwide. Our short-let services include everything from listing creation to guest communications, housekeeping, key management and price optimisation.

The role:

This role is Onboarding and Quality Control Intern role within the Operations team, which will suit an individual with an entrepreneurial spirit and an analytical mind, who wants to gain valuable experience and exposure at a rapidly scaling start-up. This could be your opportunity to join a high growth and dynamic growing start-up and compete with your skills, experience and exposure to build yourself and build the company at the same time.

What you will be doing:

Creation of listings across different platforms
Supporting the Account Manager with the onboarding process of the properties
Ensure quality and appealing written listings, and consistency of information across all listings
Translation of texts
Being the ‘behind-the-scenes’ face of GuestReady, with a flexible can-do attitude when other tasks are required
Coordinating photoshoots of the properties
Working closely with the rest of our Team to devise the best ways to keep providing an amazing guest and host experience, with a personal touch.
Quality controlling the listings and promptly addressing any issues raised during or after our guests’ stay.
Continuously contributing to improving our processes as we scale up, to achieve maximum efficiency and cost optimisation at each stage.
Supporting and assisting the team with any other day-to-day operational tasks, as needed.

Who we are looking for:

Fluent in English
Being detailed-oriented is key to success in this position
Consistent ability to write clear and attractive copy for blog posts/listings/articles
Multi-tasker, able to work under pressure, staying calm and composed.
Able to prioritise many tasks at the same time and to manage time efficiently.
Fast problem solver; being able to seek solutions instantly for any given problem.
Team player; able to work in an environment with high inter-dependencies between teams and cross-cultural colleagues.
Detail-oriented individual with a strong focus on quality – Please tell us about your best (or worst!) Airbnb experience in your cover letter!
Confident and personable, with a passion for creating a great customer experience by catering to their needs and striving for continuous improvement of our ***** service
Interest in startups and the sharing economy is a big plus. Ideally you will have experience using home sharing platforms such as Airbnb, Home Away, etc. and passion to see the concept flourish

Benefits:

Work with multicultural team members and international teams, spread across the globe
Exposure to the fast-paced world of high-tech start-ups, with excellent growth opportunities
You will be working with a team of experienced entrepreneurs who have successfully built companies before
A dynamic work environment with low hierarchies and space for your own ideas
Opportunity to look after some amazing homes across London
Challenging and diverse tasks which will let you grow day by day (depending on your abilities!)
This is a paid internship about 800£ per month + travel allowance

items.title: Remote Outbound Sales Executive
items.content:
The main activity of the role will be to make sales calls from home (ideally based in the USA) to sign up campsites and holiday parks to take bookings via our website. You will also help clients complete the registration process.

Other duties include:

* Developing and maintaining a strong network of contacts and to support relationships with key supplier decision makers

* Discovering and following up for new products/units as required

* Promoting product internally and providing recommendations on product as and when required

* Monitoring and analysing results, and ensuring client inventory is adequate and their allocation levels meet company requirements

Candidates will join a nimble team at a young company with extraordinary growth potential.

We are looking for candidates able to dedicate between 15 to 25 hours per week. Hours for the role can vary from week to week and can be flexible to work around you and your family. Some travel may be involved, but this is optional.

You will be paid an hourly rate of $15 + commission.

The candidate

Candidates should be self-starters, extremely flexible as far as tasks are concerned, and able to prioritise based on company needs while meeting tight deadlines. The successful candidate will fulfil the following additional criteria:

* Demonstrated business development experience including cold calling

* Organised and methodical approach

* A willingness to be a 'jack-of-all-trades' for the sake of being part of a forward-thinking start-up

* At least two years' experience in a related field

* Own computer

* Internet savvy

* Ability to troubleshoot independently

* A desire to take a big part in the establishment of Pitchup.com as a modern, creative brand

* General administrative skills, as well as experience within a customer-facing sector

* Excellent communication skills and phone manner

* Switched ON

To apply, please submit your details outlining your direct sales and any camping/outdoor experience.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=64, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Account Executive at Facet Wealth

Remote | International

Location: Baltimore 21202 United States

About Facet

Facet is disrupting the wealth management industry. Our innovative technology and unique advisor model allow us to deliver high quality financial services to the 33 million mass affluent households in the US. As a company, our goals are:

  • Help millions of Americans achieve their financial goals through high quality financial advice previously not available to them
  • Build the next generation of financial planning and financial life management tools that redefine how wealth management is delivered
  • Create a company culture that is as fun as it is stimulating

Our Promise to You

  • A-players: Life is too short to work with people who aren’t rock stars
  • Data Wins: We are objective to a fault
  • Integrity: Helping people with their money requires incredible trust. We do not take this lightly.
  • Everyone Has a Voice: Great ideas can come from anywhere. We will always listen
  • Continuous Improvement: we commit to always asking how we can be better, in everything that we do (including the hiring process!)

The Job: What We Need

We are looking for a hungry, agile person ready to propel their sales career. As part of the B2B sales team, you will be responsible for managing all of Facet’s top-of-funnel processes and efforts as directed by Head of Partnerships. We work with other financial advisors, platforms, and industry partners as a responsible referral partner and to transition their small accounts to Facet and run a B2B sales process to identify these potential prospects and partners. You will be responsible for all outreach and qualification of these folks and will work closely with the rest of the sales team to build our pipeline.

Your Responsibilities

  • You are responsible for all top-of-funnel sales efforts, including email campaigns and cold calling. You feed our sales team with qualified opportunities.
  • A/B test and optimize email/ cold call campaigns to generate maximum response and interest in partnering with Facet
  • Work closely with channel partners and manage partner relationships to generate leads
  • Work closely with our sales and marketing teams to relay market feedback. You are Facet Wealth’s front lines, and the knowledge you gather will be used to create content to maximize awareness of Facet in the financial services industry

About You

Requirements

  • You have 2+ years of experience in sales
  • You are comfortable owning a number: you will be measured on the number of qualified opportunities that you generate for the sales team
  • You are process-oriented and diligent (coordinating and running lots of outreach processes)
  • You are outgoing and not afraid to get on the phone (a big part of this job will be outward-facing)
  • You are hungry and a self-starter. You can manage your own workload with little-to-no oversight, and you want to build a company. The sky is the limit with this job: if you do it well, you will advance quickly in the organization
  • You are innovative and always looking for efficiencies

Pluses

  • You have experience in financial services and are fluent in industry jargon
  • You understand the tools: experience using Salesforce, email tools, and lead-gen databases
  • You want to be a sales person.

Perks

  • Competitive salary and significant equity: we pay up for the best talent
  • Unlimited vacation: we trust you
  • All the benefits: health insurance, 401(k), etc (oh, and a dedicated financial planner)
  • Fast-Paced Office Culture: We’re building a company together, so the office is lively and you will learn a lot.
  • Work from anywhere: Although this role is based in Baltimore, our founders are big fans of remote work
  • Work with the best: see our A-player credo above
  • Take a shot at helping millions of people live better financial lives
Apply for job

items.title: Growth Machine : Inside Sales Representative
items.content:
Inside Sales Representative

Growth Machine is expanding quickly, and we need your help to grow even faster.

We've grown from 0 to 7-figures with our founder handling all the sales, but now we're bringing in our first sales reps. You'll work with our founder and to take our current sales process, master it, improve it, and help grow our business to the next level.

You'll learn a ton about how we use content marketing and SEO to grow new and established sites, and you'll get to work closely with our agency team to identify good fit clients, show them the benefits of investing in SEO, and bring them onboard.

This is an amazing role for an experienced, hungry individual who wants to have ownership of the sales process and make it their own.
So if you're a self-motivated sales person familiar with the digital marketing world, this may be your dream role.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES 

Handle our inbound leads.
We get around 60 leads per month reaching out to work with us. You'll be in charge of qualifying these leads, contacting your share of them, and closing deals ranging from $30,000 to over $100,000.

This will include making sure they are good fits for us, understanding which of our services is the best fit for them, being able to communicate the value of working with us, and closing the deal to bring them in to the agency.

Build our outbound sales funnel.
Once you have a good handle on your portion of our inbound funnel, you'll work on building up our outbound sales funnel by identifying good-fit sites and pitching them on working with Growth Machine.

This is an area we've explored somewhat in the past, but haven't been able to pursue since our inbound volume has been high enough to keep us busy. But now that we're growing more, this will be an important source of new clients.

Assist in on-boarding new clients.
We want to make sure all of our clients are treated well and that we can make sure they're successful, so you'll be in charge of making sure their questions are answered and they feel excited to get started as you hand them off to the agency team that will be executing their project.

REQUIREMENTS

  • You're experienced in high-value sales. If you haven't sold at least $100,000 of work in the last year, this role isn't for you. Most of our packages are $5,000-$12,000 per month, with six month minimums, so you should be experienced selling products or services in that range.
  • You're familiar with SEO and content marketing. Personal experience with a blog or content site is a plus since you'll be speaking to a lot of heads of marketing and need to be able to come across as an authority representing our expertise.
  • You're a self-starter. This is a role with a ton of room for growth. You need to be confident setting and hitting your own goals, and eventually leading other salespeople as we grow our team.
  • You can close without being annoying. We don't want to hire "that sales guy." We've succeeded with softer, slow selling, and we have no interest in turning this into Wolf of Wall Street.
  • You have great communication and people skills. You're experienced in and comfortable managing client expectations and making sure clients are well taken care of.
  • You love systems. You're always looking for ways to improve the process, whether by adjusting, automating, or another way.

BENEFITS

  • Salary Plus Commission: You can earn $120k-$200k per year in this role, potentially more as the company continues to grow.
  • Upward Mobility: You'll have the opportunity to move up to a Head of Sales role as the company and sales team grows.
  • Remote Work: We’re a 100% remote company, so you can work anywhere in a US timezone. A few of us are in Austin, but you don't have to be.
  • Health Insurance: Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance for you and your family.
  • 401k: We have a 401k for all employees with a 4% match.
  • Team Retreats: Three team trips per year to cities like Austin, LA, Chicago to get some time together in person.
  • Vacation and Holiday: Four weeks of paid vacation, and we take off all major holidays, including a week over the New Year. You also get your birthday off!

items.title: Business Development Representative
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Business Development Representative at SafeGraph

Remote | International

ANYWHERE

SALES

FULL TIME

As SafeGraph’s first Business Development Representative, you’ll be responsible for growing, managing, and qualifying top of funnel pipeline for the Sales & Business Development teams. Leveraging email, phone, and social channels you’ll build and execute a playbook to engage with both inbound and outbound leads, and identify which organizations are ready to move forward with evaluating SafeGraph’s Places data offerings. This role will report to the VP of Business Development.

Opportunity to:

  • become an expert in SafeGraph’s data products & value proposition
  • be SafeGraph’s first BDR and own the qualification process for all sales and business development opportunities
  • build scalable outbound lead generation campaigns
  • leverage business & industry knowledge to discover companies, identify key players, create interest, and develop accounts
  • document, manage and report on all work using Salesforce
  • work with an amazing team
  • be one of the first 30 people in a very-fast growing company

About you:

  • have a go-getter attitude and walk through walls
  • have a track record of overachieving in customer facing role
  • are highly organized and able to adapt to changing priorities
  • resilient in the face of rejection
  • intent listener & passionate communicator
  • commitment to growth in sales

About SafeGraph:

  • SafeGraph is a B2B data company that sells data about physical places in the world to data scientists and machine learning engineers.
  • Our mission is to make the world’s data open for innovation. Uses of our data so far include:
    • Map out places which could provide food or shelter during natural disasters
    • Inform equity trading decisions
    • Understand how quickly an area subject to a natural disaster recovers
    • Determine how far people will travel to restaurants based on type of cuisine
    • Retail real estate site selection
    • Create advertising audiences
    • Quantify the effectiveness of advertising campaigns
    • In-app personalization
  • SafeGraph raised a $20 million Series A in 2017 and became profitable earlier this year. CEO previously was founder and CEO of LiveRamp (NYSE: RAMP).
  • Based in San Francisco, open to remote employees.
Apply for job

items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
Solutions Architect, Pre-Sales, Enterprise Networking, CCIE, Cisco R/S, SDN

An established technology Solutions Provider and Cisco VAR is seeking experienced and motivated Senior Solutions Architects/ Pre Sales Engineers with expertise in Cisco R&S / Enterprise Network Solutions design. This will be a Lead role for the entire region and offer the ability to work remotely from home when not in front of clients in the region.

Seeking proven professionals who can work with account teams to develop and close opportunities and drive revenue!

Top Reasons to Work with Us

- Remote from home when not in front of clients
- Opportunity to join a practice that is is rapid growth mode
- Competitive compensation packages
- Relocation assistance is offered!
- Work with established Cisco Gold Partners

What You Will Be Doing

- Perform in a Lead role as a Pre Sales Solutions Architect while also being the SME for enterprise clients
- Provide technical support and consultation to account executives using your expertise of networking, security and/ or data center
- Design solutions for customers and document the scope of projects
- Assist in driving overall revenue and increase profitability
- Align the business needs of customers and prospects to a technical solution and presenting the solution the customer in terms of business benefits

What You Need for this Position

- Strong Cisco R&S Networking Expertise
- Minimum 5 years of experience with Cisco products: switches, routers, wireless, firewalls, Sourcefire, nexus, etc.
- Strong Pre Sales Experience
- Active CCIE (CCNP is also accepted if coming from a VAR)
- Experience with Cisco Security, Data Center and/ or Collaboration are a plus
- Extensive experience with Cisco Enterprise Solutions and
- Designing network solutions for enterprise customers
- Proven experience of successful solution selling
- Proven presentation and sales skills
- Excellent communication, documentation and customer facing skills

What's In It for You

- Relocation Assistance!
- Competitive Base Salary (DOE)
- Work remote from home when no in front of clients
- Minimal travel
- Comprehensive Benefits Package
- PTO
- Opportunity for growth
- 401k
- Great work environment
- Other cool perks!If you are an experienced Sr. Network Solutions Architect, you are encouraged to apply ASAP or you can send your resume to me directly at

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

- Not a fit for this position? Click the link at the bottom of this email to search all of our open positions.

Looking forward to receiving your resume!

CyberCoders

CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Your Right to Work - In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

items.title: Sales Team Member
items.content:
Sales Team Member at Infinity Software Development

Remote | Entry-level | International

Infinity is looking to add a person to our Sales Team to help us create new relationships and business opportunities for our fast-growing organization. If you are interested in technology and/or sales and can:

  • Build relationships quickly
  • Listen for needs
  • Convert needs to opportunities
  • Be authentic
  • Bonus points for previous sales experience
  • Double bonus points for insurance industry background

then we want to talk to you. We are looking for local candidates, but are open to working remotely with the right person.

Apply for job

items.title: Sales Leader-Stationary Power Systems- REMOTE
items.content:
A large critical power system distributor in the Northeast is looking for a highly driven and energetic Sales Leader. The Role You'll Play This company is growing fast. The Northeastern US territory is critical to that business growth, and the opportunity to take a large chunk of the US and own it is right there waiting for the right dynamic and technically skilled sales manager to take it and run with it. They offer innovative product lines in support of stationary/reserve power systems across a spectrum of industries including telco, data center, government, military, and utilities. If you have the contacts within those industries to put sales quotas to bed easily, then this role will reward you exceptionally well. In this role, you will have the chance to demonstrate your exceptional out of the box thinking while developing creative solutions to your clients' needs. If you are tired of being a small cog in a big wheel, then this role may offer you the autonomy and opportunity to demonstrate your technical expertise and client management skills to their greatest advantage. An organized and efficient thinker with a strong ethical mindset, you value the advantages of both working independently, and with the support of a small close-knit team of remote based sales managers across the US. We are looking for people with skills and experience they are proud of, such as: A true hunter. The kind of sales rockstar who has spearheaded exponential sales growth for a smaller company's products within the critical power sector. Independent and self-driven, you know exactly what it takes to be successful on the road managing a territory.Demonstrate thorough knowledge and expertise across all aspects of stored power systems, with a proven track record of solution based sales working with engineering and procurement teams both internally and externally.Experience working for both larger and smaller vendors in the critical/backup power industry.An outstanding network of active contacts within data center, telco, utilities, solar and wind power industries as well as any other business with critical backup power requirements.Can take a large territory filled with opportunity and make it your own. 'First person on the ground' experience would be very useful. Although this territory has had some work done within it, the field is wide open for growth. Community Wherever you call home, this is a remote position!Access to good high-speed internet serviceAll the benefits associated with working on a distributed team Background ProfileMinimum of 5 years of Stationary Power System sales experience including Stationary battery sales, system design of DC power and distribution equipment.Bachelors Degree in business, Electrical Engineering, or another technical field, plus sales experienceKnowledge of industry standards i.e. IEEE, NEMA, NERC, UL, etc. Computer: proficiency with Microsoft suite, CRM packages

items.title: All Web Leads: Insurance Sales Agent - Life & Health
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Insurance Sales Agent - Life & Health

Here at Medicare Genius, our agents focus on helping seniors untangle the complexities of Medicare and help them find health insurance plans that give them peace of mind. As a Medicare Genius Policy Sales Agent you will have access to all the top Medicare supplement and related ancillary products in the market, and your job will be to help your clients find the products that best meet their NEEDS and BUDGET all from the convenience of your own  home.

Unlike many insurance sales roles, Medicare Genius agents do not make cold calls, but receive direct inbound calls, warm transfers, and call on warm leads of interested consumers. Bottom line, our agents spend more time talking to clients and less time finding prospects. Because of this, the close rate and commission potential is much greater than at other companies, and we pay commissions for every policy sold (no caps or commission limits).

  • Talk with pre-qualified prospects about their Medicare insurance needs and match them with products that meet those needs.
  • Overcome objections through active listening and education resulting in informed decision making.
  • Answer questions related to coverage options and guide consumers through the health insurance policy selection and application process.
  • Close Medicare plan transactions meeting or exceeding sales goals.
  • Have fun, collaborate with your colleagues and know at the end of each day you did your personal best. 

What you need to bring to this opportunity:

  • You’ve done the sales thing. Demonstrated track record of success ideally with Medicare and/or individual health insurance.  Call center/phone sales experience a plus.
  • Consultative selling approach, good listener and empathetic in working with the senior market.
  • Skillful in building rapport, conveying information with a systematic approach and in guiding a conversation from hello to thank you for buying.
  • Naturally competitive with an internal drive in competing with yourself and colleagues in achieving new goals. Staying positive believing the next call will be the one that gets you a sale.
  • Being efficient with your time in working with a customer, colleague or manager.  Know when to move on from a call or stay with it.  Self-motivating and task oriented.
  • Demonstrated strong technical skills, being able to multitask and manipulate multiple screens including various software systems, quote engine, carrier application while continuing a conversation with the customer.
  • High school diploma or equivalent is required, Bachelor’s degree preferred.
  • A valid TX state-issued insurance license. Must reside in Texas.
What we provide:

  • Pre-qualified customers, multiple nationally recognized carriers and broad breadth of products – Medicare supplements, Medicare Advantage plans and ancillary products including dental and vision.
  • On-site training and we cover the cost of licensing if needed with ongoing coaching to help you be successful. Laptop computer provided.
  • The convenience of working from home.  No commuting hassles.  In addition, growth opportunities and career advancement between business units.
  • High earning potential. Competitive pay with uncapped commission and top performers eligible for performance bonus. ($75,000-$135,000)
  • Full benefits including health, dental, vision, 401k and paid time-off
If this opportunity looks like a good fit, we'd like to meet you!
Find out more about us:
