items.title: Operations & Account Manager (f/m/d) // Trust Fractal GmbH
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
Operations & Account Manager (f/m/d) // Trust Fractal

Company: Trust Fractal

Tags:
  • English
  • Salesforce
  • Account Manager
    • Location: Berlin, Germany
    • Position: Full-time
    • Start date: Immediately

    ABOUT US

    As a RegTech company, we are enabling a global open-finance ecosystem by providing simple and compliant identity services. Our Fractal ID solution offers an onboarding process for providers of financial services such as Crowdfunding-, Crypto-Wallet-, Exchanges and Digital Banking services. We ensure a secure data environment, global regulatory compliance and a smooth onboarding process for these benefit of services and users alike. Fractal currently operates offices in Berlin, Porto & Singapore and employs a team of around thirty people worldwide.

    JOB PROFILE

    We’re looking for a qualified and enthusiastic candidate to take up a full-time  Operations & Account Manager (f/m/d) position within our international team. Reporting to the  Senior Operations Manager, the Operations & Account Manager is responsible for all aspects associated with client account management, KYC vendors and other processes within the Operations team. The main responsibilities are:

    Account management:

    • Serving as the lead point of contact for all customer account management matters
    • Taking over newly closed accounts from the Sales team & onboarding them
    • Ensuring the timely and successful implementation and delivery of our solution according to customer needs, objectives and agreed service levels
    • Building and maintaining strong, long-lasting client relationships
    • Upselling & extending  contracts with existing clients
    • Developing trusted advisor relationships with key accounts and customer stakeholders
    • Forecast and track key account metrics (e.g. quarterly sales results and annual forecasts)
    • Preparing reports on account status
    • Assisting with challenging client requests or issue escalations as needed

    KYC vendors management: 

    • Answering to suppliers requests
    • Partial ownership of the day-to-day execution of the vendor side KYC/AML process
    • Researching and building Fractal’s global KYC/AML vendors ecosystem
    • Clearly communicating the progress of  initiatives to internal and external stakeholders
    • Achieving supplier-side KPIs along with the Operations team
    • KYC vendor quality control
    • Coordinating with KYC/AML suppliers to  understand their pain points and feedback
    • Translating supplier feedback into actionable items (process- & product-wise)
    • Coordinating with supplier facing Product team to convey vendor feedback and pain points and ensuring implementation of relevant product features

    Operations processes: 

    • Drafting, reviewing and updating operations process related documentation
    • Dealing with escalated or critical KYC/AML cases within Fractal’s software
    • Handling GDPR & data deletion requests according to the operational guidelines
    • Resolving  to user inquiries received through e-mail related to the onboarding procedure
    • Escalating issues requiring more in-depth knowledge to a Senior member of the team

    YOUR PROFILE

    • You have 1+ years proven work experience as an Account Manager, Key Account Manager, Sales Account Manager, Junior Account Manager or other relevant role
    • You know how to identify relevant internal and external stakeholders, gather relevant requirements and craft actionable solutions
    • You possess a demonstrable ability to communicate, present and influence key stakeholders at all levels of an organization, including executive and C-level
    • You’re proactive and solution oriented
    • You have solid command of at least one CRM software (e.g. Salesforce or HubSpot) and Office Suite (e.g. MS Office, Google Apps, particularly Excel & Sheets), knowledge of a customer support software such as Zendesk is a plus
    • You like to deliver client-focused solutions that satisfy customer needs
    • You’re a multi-tasker with the ability to juggle projects at different stages with varying levels of complexity, all while maintaining an eye for detail and customer satisfaction
    • You have excellent listening, negotiation and presentation abilities
    • Your strong verbal and written communication skills are hard to resist
    • You’re fluent in the English language, other languages are a plus
    • You completed a Bachelor degree in Business Administration, Management, Sales or other relevant field

    WHY FRACTAL?

    You’ll take up a position as one of the central members of a RegTech Startup team in Berlin, delivering value and quality to clients with a direct line to internal and external senior management. We work with reputable clients in the blockchain space, building products for the blockchain ecosystem as well as established financial institutions. You have a chance to work in a truly international and multidisciplinary environment that heavily relies on technical insights, legal expertise, and user-focused design.

    We offer:

    • A competitive salary,
    • A MacBook Pro as workstation,
    • A yearly conference budget to support your personal development,
    • A subsidy to your monthly fitness membership,
    • Complimentary drinks & healthy snacks,
    • A yearly company retreat for the entire team – this year we’re going to Porto!
    • Regular team-events,
    • not to mention a stylish, well-connected office in the heart of Kreuzberg!

    You’ll be part of a great company culture, in a multidisciplinary and global  team, open to remote work and flexible working hours, where your voice is heard – our people really love coming to work here!

    SOUNDS GOOD TO YOU?

    To apply for this job position, please follow this link: https://fractal.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=6

    Apply for this position

items.title: Alliance Partnership Account Manager
items.content:
Alliance Partnership Account Manager at Red Hat

Remote

Location: US-Remote

Job ID

70832

Category

Alliance or Partner Sales, Business Development

Remote base

California

Company description

At Red Hat, we connect an innovative community of customers, partners, and contributors to deliver an open source stack of trusted, high-performing solutions. We offer cloud, Linux, middleware, storage, and virtualization technologies, together with award-winning global customer support, consulting, and implementation services. Red Hat is a rapidly growing company supporting more than 90% of Fortune 500 companies.

Job summary

The Red Global Partners and Alliances team is looking for an experienced Alliance Partnership Account Manager to join us. In this role, you will guide relationships with emerging global strategic partners. You’ll develop and carry out multi-year plans to grow revenue with these partners. Your primary focus will be the development of joint strategies and initiatives across Red Hat and the partners as well as the creation of go-to-market programs in support of these initiatives. Successful applicants must reside in a state where Red Hat is registered to do business.

Primary job responsibilities

  • Build and carry out joint global business plans with clear goals, objectives, and metrics
  • Promote bookings growth aligned with and in support of the growth plans of Red Hat’s business teams and regions
  • Develop and carry out joint strategies with the partners to grow our joint business
  • Guide partner investments in Red Hat’s technologies, solutions, skills, marketing, and go-to-market programs
  • Effectively manage market development funds (MDF) to achieve results
  • Build and manage executive relationships across key stakeholders at the partners and Red Hat
  • Develop joint scalable solutions that address marketplace changes
  • Develop and implement joint marketing and go-to-market programs with the partners to guide pipeline and sales
  • Coordinate with other Red Hat’s alliance leaders and partners to guide 3-way partnering
  • Support the field sales team in achieving their goals with partners on a global basis
  • Oversee partner management, including contract negotiations, the development of strategic and mutually beneficial relationships, and the managing of collaborative programs
  • Provide guidance to and work effectively across the Red Hat internal stakeholders, including field sales, product business, finance, legal, and business affairs teams
  • Establish and maintain regular communication cadence with same stakeholder constituents

Required skills

  • 5+ years of experience in alliances or business development, managing global, industry-leading partner(s)
  • Experience across multiple partner routes to market including original equipment manufacturers (OEMs), resale, or cloud
  • Demonstrated ability to apply personal knowledge, processes, and solutions selling strategies and methodologies to meet revenue growth objectives
  • Proven leader with a record of guiding global, virtual teams and delivering results
  • Relationship-focused with a solid executive presence and proven ability to build credibility with partner and internal executives
  • Ability to thrive in a dynamic, changing environment and make personal connections with technical-oriented people as well as C-level audiences
  • Good planning and analytical skills; proven ability to apply these skills to complex situations with competing priorities
  • Proven ability to partner with senior business leaders to understand requirements and deliver solutions that meet expectations
  • Highly collaborative work style with proven ability to gather consensus and take decisive and timely action
  • Bachelor’s degree; MBA is a plus
  • Experience conducting business in the U.S. and overseas in Europe, the Asia Pacific (APAC) region, and Latin America (LATAM) is a plus
  • Knowledge of Red Hat, open source, Linux, middleware, and virtualization is a plus

Red Hat is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. We review applications for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, uniformed services, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Red Hat does not seek or accept unsolicited resumes or CVs from recruitment agencies. We are not responsible for, and will not pay, any fees, commissions, or any other payment related to unsolicited resumes or CVs except as required in a written contract between Red Hat and the recruitment agency or party requesting payment of a fee.

Apply for job

items.title: Inbound DIRECTV Sales Calls - Work From Home
items.content: Inbound DIRECTV Sales Calls - Work From Home Digital Plus, DIRECTV Authorized Retailer is seeking sales professionals. Available: Beginning of April 2015 / Mid April 2015 Job: Inbound Sales Calls - Work from Home (Internet Connection and Phone Line Required) Income: Average $2,000 per month (see more listed below) Take inbound sales calls of potential new customers. It is your job to close, process, and schedule each sale for installation. Commissions are paid bi-weekly once sale is confirmed it has been installed. This job is for individuals who are serious, self-motivated, driven to make their own sales and the knowledge to close plus overcome common objections. Training classes are available online as needed. You absolutely must love sales and helping customers find the right solution for theirs needs. Commission Only; 1099 independent contractor job, sell DIRECTV Genie along with internet service (if available) and make between $1,000 to $2,000 per month for the first 3 months. $1,800 to $2,500 after probation with performance incentives. This is a fulltime job and you are always on call for sales calls. Which means, you can work from home and still do other related home tasks (cleaning, laundry, preparing lunch, playing games, watching TV) but when a sales call comes in, you are expected to be available to take the call during your scheduled time frame and focus on the call from the moment you pick up without any other loud background noise or distractions. If this is something you are interested in, please shoot us a short email with related experiences and list skills you excel in. And generalize in a short summary your sales experience and why you think this job would fit you best. PLEASE APPLY ONLINE @ www.GoDishUSA.com/ApplyforJobs.htm Must have a clean background with No Felony Convictions. 18 Years or Older Experiences Selling Related Services Must Live within 50 Miles from the location of this Job Post If you have further questions, please message us. We only are accepting serious inquires via email / messages first, please attach your short description of related experiences and a resume along with a good contact number. If interested we will contact you normally within 7 to 14 business days.

items.content:
Internship role to work with sales and marketing function of Nottx.

3. Curate the initial conversations for the sales team.
4. Research the market and conduct due diligence.
5. Identify and manage growth hacking.
8. Keep up to date with industry related news and events by reading related publications etc.
9. Manage social media and search engine analytical tools for campaigns and monitoring.
10. Report figures, developments etc. in a timely manner to the line manager.

Skills, Qualifications and Experience:
• Excellent customer service skills. Excellent organisational skills.
• Excellent written and oral communication skills; the ability to communicate effectively, exemplary professional conduct.
• Ability to meet targets and strict deadlines and work well under pressure. Attention to detail, highly organised and efficient approach to tasks. Competent in the use of Microsoft Office products.
• Marketing certificate/degree helps but not mandatory.

Other Essential Attributes:
• A can-do attitude to confront problems proactively and create successful solutions.
• A good team member and supportive colleague.
• A passion for continuous improvement, creativity and result orientation.
• Willingness to work flexibly to meet the requirements of the role.
• Ability to work independently and remotely without continuous supervision.

Development:
Nottx is passionate about developing aspiring young talents. The candidate will have hands on experience with all areas of marketing activities. Candidate will have opportunity to work alongside management team thus providing unique opportunity to involve with business and strategy. Achieve a suitable reference for your first steps in your career. This job description provides an outline of the major focus areas of the job role and is not exhaustive and is subject to amendment from time to time.

Note:
You are free to work from anywhere you like although there will be occasional meeting that you would need to attend at our offices in London. This roles is very suitable for an individual who is looking for a Sales and Marketing career.

Apply immediately and we are soon starting the interviews.

items.title: Area Sales Manager- Rotating Equipment- REMOTE/TRAVEL
items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
Rotating Equipment Sales Experience, Chemical/Industrial BU Account Management, Outside Sales, Selling to EPCs/End Users

Title: Area Sales Manager
Region: Western US/Canada- work remotely with travel
Compensation: $110-125k base% SIP

We are a large and growing manufacturing firm and we design, develop and manufacture highly engineered products to serve the oil/gas, chemical, power generation, water supply, mining and industrial industries. We're looking to grow our global business and currently in need of a talented and driven Sales Manager to head up our Western Region and manage our key accounts.

Top Reasons to Work with Us

-Full Benefits- Medical/Dental/Vision + FSP/HSA
-Commuter Benefits
-Tuition Reimbursement
-Paid Sick Leave
-Generous PTO
-Several Paid Holidays
-401K

What You Will Be Doing

Overall, you will execute sales and account strategies in the western US and western Canadian region to increase revenue and grow our business. You'll work directly with our main accounts, coordinate sales activities through select channel partners in your territory. Another part of the position will be to assess and optimize routes to market and reach target customer segments. Other major responsibilities will include:

1.) Deliver against regional unit and aftermarket booking targets
2.) Manage bookings, sales forecasting and pipelines for Western US/Canadian region
3.) Prep and deliver regional sales and bookings reports
4.) Key account relationship management
5.) Increase bookings and sales with target Chemical/Industrial BU customer accounts
6.) Work with channel partners to identify current or under served accounts and develop selling strategies to optimize customer penetration
7.) Provide technical consulting and commercial support to ensure booking targets are met in defined territories
8.) Provide VOC input on desired customer solutions & service offerings

What You Need for this Position

REQUIRED:

1.) Experience in selling rotating equipment in refining, chemical and industrial marketplace
2.) Knowledge of pumps used in process and industrial applications
3.) Experience selling to both EPCs and End Users
4.) 8-10+ years of sales experience

NICE TO HAVE:

1.) Knowledge of process gas compressors
2.) International experience

What's In It for You

-Full Benefits- Medical/Dental/Vision + FSP/HSA
-Commuter Benefits
-Tuition Reimbursement
-Paid Sick Leave
-Generous PTO
-Several Paid Holidays
-401K

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

Solutions Architect, Pre-Sales, Enterprise Networking, CCIE, Cisco R/S, SDN

An established technology Solutions Provider and Cisco VAR is seeking experienced and motivated Senior Solutions Architects/ Pre Sales Engineers with expertise in Cisco R&S / Enterprise Network Solutions design. This will be a Lead role for the entire region and offer the ability to work remotely from home when not in front of clients in the region.

Seeking proven professionals who can work with account teams to develop and close opportunities and drive revenue!

Top Reasons to Work with Us

- Remote from home when not in front of clients

items.title: Business Development Professional - Remote
items.content:
Job Description

Company:

HireResources is a rapidly growing national executive recruiting firm. We are diversified in a number of high-growth verticals including but not limited to Market Research/Insights; Data Analytics; SAAS; High Tech Manufacturing; Life Sciences; Information Technology. We have a unique and dynamic operating model which allows our team to work remotely from home offices throughout the country. As we continue our rapid expansion, we seek top performing sales and business development executives to help us continue to grow our client relationships.

Job Outline:

We seek a sales/business development representative professional to help us grow our SAAS Recruiting Practice.

The new business development representative is responsible for identifying and developing strategic business relationships with a broad spectrum of cross-industry clients, working closely with the Team Leaders and Senior Management to identify prospective client company prospects. We provide all industry leads.

As the Business Development Manager, you will take the lead in the development of new business opportunities that supports our Company's overall growth strategy.

We are seeking someone with an entrepreneurial spirit, passion for sales and a proven track record of success, who takes a hands-on approach to building business opportunities. In this key position, you will target Senior Level Hiring Managers and Human Resources leaders actively promoting our Executive Recruiting and Staffing Services to achieve sales goals by signing up new clients seeking our services.

The ideal candidate relishes the thrill of the hunt , constantly winning new business and earning the respect and admiration of colleagues and clients alike.

This is a 100% commission only role offering unlimited earning potential with a very aggressive commission plan and no quotas. It is also a remote role (working from your home office). The right candidate has the potential to earn in the high six figures annually.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Research and develop a thorough understanding of the company s vision, strategic priorities, people, capabilities, and practice specialties.
  • Develop new business opportunities with potential clients, focusing on converting qualified prospects by presenting compelling business propositions and solutions.
  • Prepare and present powerful, persuasive sales presentations that demonstrate the compelling value proposition and USPs of our services, notably our seasoned team of specialty recruiters and expertise at qualifying and placing the best available talent in the market-place.
  • Develop and execute a strategic business plan that meets or exceeds established sales goals and supports company revenue and profitability targets.
  • Develop and maintain a robust, targeted deal pipeline to continuously grow the business and generate sales.
  • Research, establish and build influential relationships with client decision makers at management and C-suite levels.
  • Maintain consistent sales growth by continuously establishing new accounts and positioning us as a strategic advisor delivering actionable insights and practical business solutions.
  • Identify opportunities for campaigns, services, and distribution channels that will lead to an increase in sales.
  • Attend conferences and professional association meetings, promote our service solutions and provide feedback on market trends.
  • Track and record systematically sales activity in BullHorn and review regularly performance vs targets with Managing Partners and wider team

Earnings Potential:

  • You will contract new client accounts and hand over day to day management of those accounts to our Team Leaders
  • Accounts will be managed to ensure open positions are filled expeditiously
  • Every open job HireResources fills leads to a placement fee.
  • You receive commissions on every placement for the life of the client relationship. Thus a residual income stream. It is not a one time sale.

Are you a match for us? Ask yourself these 5 questions:

1) Do I want to work for myself and still have a tenured team and back-office support?
2) Is percentage of payout on my accounts more important than a base salary?
3) Would I enjoy and thrive being my own boss?
4) Does working from home or virtually anywhere interest me?
5) Do I Want to earn the highest payout in the industry?

6) Does earning a residual income on my accounts perpetually appeal to me?

If you answered yes, we should connect and talk in more detail. Either connect with me or send me an email.

Company Description

HireResources is a recruiting company.

HireResources recruiters are not generalists; they are specialists in their industries providing quick access to industry top talent in select industry sectors. We speak your language and understand the factors critical to your business. Each HireResources Sector Team has a specialized target recruitment function. In fact, if we do not have expertise in your industry, we will let you know this up front.

HireResources was established in 2002, in 2015 we began a growth phase by restructuring our core business, today, HireResources is a fast growing Staffing & Recruitment platform headquartered in Connecticut. HireResources is an open source staffing and recruiting model giving flexibility and support to top executive recruiters across the country. HireResources recruiters are thoroughly vetted and are proven professionals in the recruiting industry.

The cornerstone of HireResources success is in its commitment to ethical business practices and superb consumer service. Our \"Code of Ethics\" is the foundation of this success.

Integrity - Work honestly, every day.
People - Develop and deliver diverse talent
Customer Focus - Anticipate priorities & exceed their expectations
Respect - Value all customers and collaborate with one another
Performance - Be accountable, manage risks and deliver a high level of quality.

items.content:
Job Description

What we are looking for:

Licensed life insurance agents - or those willing to get a license - to join our team! Meet with clients that have requested our services - No Cold Calling.

No experience required, just the ability to listen to and apply our in-depth training

- Free training from our Top Producers every week

- Flexible schedule

- $500+ average commission per sale

- Easy process to get started quickly and earning commissions

Qualifications:

  • Previous experience in insurance, customer service, or other related fields desired but not required
  • Ability to build rapport with clients
  • Highly motivated
  • Comfortability with working from home
  • Ability to prioritize and multitask

Compensation: 100% commission paid daily

Benefits:

  • 70% starting commission rate with opportunity to increase commission every two months
  • Weekly training and daily support
  • No cold calling
  • Average agent makes $2,750/week
  • Opportunity to qualify for Equity bonus

* After applying for this position you will receive an email that contains further information required to get started and for scheduling an interview

Company Description

The Helin Insurance Group is a group of agents and agencies that help families in our communities find the protection they need and desire. Our clients are qualified leads that come to us requesting our knowledge and services.

Our expertise is in the following areas: Life Insurance, Mortgage Protection, Final Expense, College Funding and Retirement Planning.

items.title: Business Development Account Executive
items.content:
ScreenCloud helps businesses communicate better with their teams and customers using simple digital signage software. Think of us as the operating system for all the screens at a company.

We have over 7000 customers around the world, including household names like Amazon, BBC, Eurostar, Oxford University, and Cathay Pacific.

We’re a globally distributed team – with offices in London, Belfast, Los Angeles and Bangkok. About a third of the ScreenCloud team work remotely from their homes, cafes or the beach.

We are looking for someone to join our London team to work with an international customer base, this role is perfect for someone wanting to step into the SaaS industry.

This is a great time to come on board. We’re well-funded, have a fast growing customer base, and are established as an excellent educator. Our vision is to be the go-to brand for learning about digital signage. This is a chance to assist with our ambitious brand plans, it’s going to be quite an adventure.



https://screencloud.com



We aren’t necessarily looking for relevant experience with this hire - this would be a perfect role for a recent graduate’s first or second job. All we ask is that you’re confident, comfortable with technology and you’ll work with the team to make ScreenCloud a great place to be.

The role provides an entry into the world of consultative selling (i.e. no cold calling!), you will learn very quickly the needs and challenges that customers need help with and how to enhance what we are able to offer them. Roles include:

Respond to customers questions via email, phone and live chat

Host weekly webinars, walking potential and existing customers through ScreenCloud

Complete sales administration tasks, to ensure the sales teams can continue to work in an efficient manner

Do live demos via video call and in-person to help convert users to paid subscribers

Find inefficiencies in the sales processes and recommend how they can be improved



Requirements:

Strong interpersonal skills

A natural relationship builder

Problem solving mindset with a can-do attitude

Very strong computer literacy

Confidence and problem solving skills

A self-starter with a curious and resourceful mind

Enthusiasm to learn



Benefits:

Competitive salary

Training budget and the environment to learn and thrive

Employee shares programme

Unlimited holiday

Regular team social events and annual international offsite trip

Pick the gear and software you need to do your job well

Work around your schedule – we’re all adults, there’s no time tracking here

International team with opportunities to travel

Work within a close knit, self-driven business development team - we’re known internally for great communication and are always striving to do better than we did last week

items.title: Sales Representative
items.content:
Sales Representative at Solar Lead Factory

Remote
“…solar power will be the single largest source of electricity generation… People do not understand the magnitude of the business. It’s really very, very significant.”
-Elon Musk

Once a fringe thing hippies did, going solar is now a mainstream investment. It took over 30 years for the first 1 million solar installations to be completed. It only took another 3 years to install the second million. Solar technology is cheaper, better and more reliable than ever. Unless your head is buried in a coal mine, it’s becoming abundantly clear that solar is the future.

With rapid growth & mainstream adoption comes massive investment and opportunity in the space. Installation companies are growing quickly, making them hungry for even more growth. The technology is dialed, the installation process is clean, but it’s still a challenge to find customers. Since customers that convert into sales are the lifeblood of any company, sales leads are the raw tool that unleashes massive growth for solar installers.

That’s why we built SolarLeadFactory.

About Us:

SolarLeadFactory has helped over 511,000 homeowners looking to buy solar. We have helped hundreds of solar installers grow their businesses – and aim to help thousands more.

Our business is built on a proprietary software platform allowing us to deliver a best in class product and innovate constantly. We have in-house developers, digital marketing experts & scientists relentlessly driving the product forward.

Our mission: to unlock consumer demand for solar power.

About You:

You’re looking for a way to make a huge positive difference in the world & tap into a massive economic opportunity (some say a $10 Trillion Dollar opportunity)

You want to be part of a small but driven team making a big impact on one of the most pressing issues of our time. You share some of our core values including “Making Learning the Key Metric”, “Holding Yourself Accountable”, “Always be Testing Something,” and “Master your Craft”.

Make no mistake, this will NOT be a ‘coasting & chillin’ type job. However, the success you earn will be rewarding mentally and financially. Sales is a tester and builder of character – and ultimately about delivering solutions to one of the most important problems in an industry that is absolutely critical.

Do you want to learn? To grow? To make a difference?

Critical Skills:
  • Solar experience is not required, but an interest in solar is
  • Ambition to WIN
  • Problem solving & ability to find solutions
  • Excellent verbal & written skills
  • Ability to connect with and influence decision makers
  • Fluidity with numbers
  • Experience in selling to marketing departments a plus
  • Massive amount of (renewable) Energy, Initiative, Commitment & Perseverance
  • Do-er, creator, “make it happen-er”
Your Mission:

We are looking for someone with confidence, commitment & energy to help solar installers grow their business.

If you’re passionate about solutions selling and helping customers get more of what they need (sales) and have an interest in solar energy this might be a great fit!

You will cultivate relationships with the marketing departments and leadership teams of solar installers around the country. Along the way you’ll discover their specific needs, develop solutions to their problems and overcome obstacles to generate success.

We strive not to build the biggest sales organization, but the best. This is about getting really good at sales & helping people to the fullest extent that we can.

What you get out of this:
  • Competitive salary & huge opportunity with uncapped commission
  • Results driven workplace
  • Remote location – work from anywhere in a North American time zone
  • Your input matters! We look for the BEST. Period.
  • Work in an amazing industry. Your friends & family will say “woah, that’s cool!”
  • Fast-growing, fun-loving company. Get on the rocketship now!

We are shaking up our industry and working day in and day out to make solar on everyone’s roof. Come shape your future & the future of the world.

If you’re game to make a big difference and reap the rewards, come join us!

Location: US Locations Only

Apply for job

items.content:
We are a *Media Production Company*, not really a start up as we've been successfully operating for over 3 years. We are now looking to expand and need a motivated person to join our team. We have the strategies (new ideas are always very welcome, of course), we will train you and help in every step of the way.

*With or without experience - everyone welcome. We are looking for CONFIDENCE.

*Positive
*Motivated and excited
*Confident
*Creative
*Quick learner

Jo Martin

Producer
"London Fashion Films"

items.title: Account Executives - IT Staffing - (Phoenix Area, 100% Remote)
items.content:
Atrilogy has been recognized by CRN magazine as one of the nation-s fastest-growing IT solution providers and by Inc. magazine as one of the nation-s fastest-growing, privately-held companies.

We are rapidly expanding locally, and are seeking talented sales individuals to join our team.

Account Executive IT Consulting and Staffing Sales

Atrilogy is looking to add a strong sales executive to our staff. If you are currently in staffing sales, and looking to fulfill your potential, we may be your perfect match!

Are you?
  • Passionate about your career and looking to be part of a growing team?
  • Are you a proven sales performer?
  • Do you respond well to a challenge?


You may not even be actively looking, if you like a midsize company that has tremendous upward mobility, apply now!

Responsibilities:
  • The Account Executive is responsible for further development of our existing client base as well as prospecting and selling to new clients.
  • Account Executives are responsible for identifying potential target clients, calling and scheduling meetings and developing relationships to grow their account base.
  • An emphasis on selling IT and/or Technical staffing, consulting services, and direct hire placement.
  • Account Executives will partner with the recruiting team to drive results.
  • The Account Executive is held accountable for personal production while contributing to the overall success of regional and national team.


Requirements

2+ years- experience in business to business sales ideally selling IT and/or staffing, recruiting services.
  • Selected individual will be competent in all aspects of the sales process, prospecting, cold/warm calling, scheduling meetings, client presentations, gathering requirements and managing results.
  • Expert level skills in building relationships with new and existing clients. We are a relationship driven company.


We are looking for an individual that has the ability to work hard to achieve great results, and thrive in an entrepreneurial environment.

We offer a competitive base salary and an exceptional commission plan in our industry, and full benefits package.

Compensation: Base Pay Commensurate with Experience + Commission and Bonus Plans

For immediate consideration please submit your resume in Word format, along with daytime contact information. All submittals will be treated confidentially. Selected candidate may be asked to pass a comprehensive background, credit and/or drug screening. Principals only, no third parties please.

Established in 2000, Atrilogy Solutions Group, Inc. provides organizations of all sizes with high-quality, cost effective information technology (IT), business process and health care consulting and staffing services. Our industry-leading service model combines experienced project managers with seasoned technical and functional consultants to eliminate client uncertainty and deliver superior value and results.

Clients turn to Atrilogy for expertise in:
  • IT staffing and placement (Project Managers, Business Analysts, DBA-s, Developers, Quality Assurance and Testing, Software Configuration Management, etc.)
  • All major Enterprise Resource Planning packages (including Oracle, PeopleSoft, JD Edwards, SAP, Microsoft, Lawson)
  • Health care consulting resources and services (including ICD-10)
  • Customer Relationship Management (CRM)
  • Creative (Interactive Project Manager/Art Director, Information Architect, UI/UX Designer, Web/Graphic Design)
Atrilogy has been recognized by CRN magazine as one of the nation-s fastest-growing IT solution providers and by Inc. magazine as one of the nation-s fastest-growing, privately-held companies. Based in Irvine, California, Atrilogy also has offices in Denver, Phoenix, and Atlanta.

- provided by Dice

items.content:
Account Executive at TierPoint

Remote

Job Locations: US-IL-Chicago | US-Remote

ID: 2019-1048

Category: Sales

Department: 910 – Sales: West and Strategic

Type: Regular Full-Time

Overview

We have career opportunities in our Sales Group for an Account Executive. In this position you will build Sales relationships by prospecting for new clients, and nurturing existing customer relationships. You will coordinate between Clients and various internal teams to ensure a productive and smooth Client experience. The Account Executive role requires a motivated hunter, who has outstanding sales and relational skills. The Account Executive reports to the Regional Vice President, Sales.

Responsibilities

  • Provides quality internal and external customer service surrounding the Company values.
  • Direct responsibility for the identification, contact, qualification and development of viable new accounts.
  • Manage the prospecting plan development and execution for new accounts at a very high level.
  • Manage the communication and internal coordination of TierPoint sales support.
  • Accurate and timely forecasting.
  • Manage the on-going need to understand inter-related technologies that exist and keep current on new options as the business technologies expand and change
  • Responsible for the development, execution, and delivery of quality solution focused client presentations at a “C” level.
  • Find, train and develop indirect sales channels.
  • Manage the prospecting plan development and execution for new accounts at a very high level.
  • Responsible for the development, execution, and delivery of quality solution focused client presentations at a C level.
  • Within existing TierPoint accounts, direct responsibility for the identification, contact, qualification and development of viable new opportunities for services that aren’t being used today.
  • Manage assigned customer relationships to ensure a high level of customer satisfaction, a strong inclination toward contract renewal, and the enhancement of the TierPoint relationship with that customer through the sale of additional services.
  • Manage the communication and internal coordination of TierPoint sales support infrastructure: sales support, operations, and executive team to insure customer satisfaction.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

Qualifications / Requirements

  • College Degree preferred but will consider applicants with equivalent work-related experience with a minimum educational requirement of a H.S. Diploma or GED equivalent.
  • Must possess extraordinary drive to pursue opportunities both within the target client as well as to marshal the necessary resources within TierPoint to ensure strong solution creation and implementation of the strategy once accepted.
  • Candidates must possess exceptional written and verbal communication skills. Many of the sales activities are limited to these forms of communication and proficiency at a high level is mandatory.
  • Exceptional presentation skills are mandatory. The ability to present to a large audience of C level decision makers persuasively and with ease is mandatory.
  • Proven talent for making effective cold calls to target companies highly preferred
  • Proven expertise to develop relationships from a cold call or networking activity highly preferred.
  • Proven ability to listen, extrapolate information and leverage resources to effectively provide solutions to customer needs.
  • Ability to effectively learn technical products, services and solutions and readily apply new knowledge required
  • Minimum of 5 years of successful sales experience within a large technical account environment: previous proven expertise in managed services, data center services, Cloud-IaaS, consulting and hardware/software solutions.
  • A Driven, Positive, Upbeat Attitude. Ability to work collaboratively with multiple departments across the organization.
  • Familiarity and commitment to daily activity tracking in corporate CRM tool.
  • Any background with advanced sales training systems is advantageous.
  • We’re looking for a competitive contributor who envisions themselves elevating their career with TierPoint.
  • Candidate must possess a valid driver’s license.
  • Adequate professional experience and knowledge to perform Job Responsibilities.
  • Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and organize effectively.
  • Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Ability to work both independently and with others.
  • Ability to operate in a fast moving, team-oriented, collaborative environment with tight deadlines.
  • Proficiency in using MS Office Suite and Windows-based computer applications.

TierPoint, LLC is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, disability, pregnancy, protected medical condition, military or veteran status, genetic information, or any other protected status covered by applicable local, state or federal law. If you’d like to view a copy of the company’s affirmative action plan or policy statement, please email zachary.mallin@tierpoint.com. If you are an individual with a disability and would like to request a reasonable accommodation as part of the employment selection process, please contact Zachary Mallin at 914-610-7834 or zachary.mallin@tierpoint.com. This telephone line and email address is reserved solely for job seekers with disabilities requesting accessibility assistance or an accommodation in the job application process. Please do not call about the status of your job application if you do not require accessibility assistance or an accommodation. Messages left for other purposes, such as following up on an application or non-disability related technical issues, will not receive a response. Please click on this link to view the most recent EEO employment posters Equal Employment Opportunity Posters.

Apply for job

items.title: Account Executive, Mid-Market
items.content:
Account Executive, Mid-Market at LogicMonitor

Remote

Sales, Remote-based

About Us:

LogicMonitor is the leading SaaS based performance monitoring platform for enterprise IT.

We are a company of fun-loving, hard-working achievers. We love going to work and think you should too. We hold our company culture near and dear — we are customer-obsessed, work as one team, and strive to be better every day. These are our core values. So it’s no surprise that we work hard and genuinely have fun working with each other to achieve great things together.

This position can be remote-based, offering you the flexibility to work out of your home office full-time. You’ll have easy access to and support from your manager and frequent video meetings to keep you plugged into your team. When you join LogicMonitor, you will be working alongside some of the brightest minds in one of the fastest growing global software firms. We are looking for you to bring your expertise, drive, and passion. This is your chance to join us on our journey as we expand our global presence and achieve record-breaking success.

What You’ll Do:

The Account Executive at LogicMonitor is a hunter role, who is to schedule meeting with target accounts and build a compelling business case for LogicMonitor. We’re looking for goal oriented candidates who understand how to attack a territory and get meetings with decision makers.

Through our sales process, our Account Executive will successfully discover and present the value of LogicMonitor to prospects, manage the entire sales cycle, and successfully win new business for the Company. The Account Executive acts as the primary contact for prospects managing the entire sales experience for each prospect within their territory. The Account Executive is responsible for self-identifying and outreaching to Target Accounts within their territory, and working with their team’s Inside Sales Reps to strategize and execute on additional outbound messaging for pipeline creation. The Account Executive will call on Sales Engineer resources for technical expertise so that the prospect fully experiences the product and understands the technical aspects of the LogicMonitor platform.

The Account Executive will coordinate professional service scoping calls and customer success hand-over calls with the customer. The Account Executive will also work closely with Marketing counterparts, and the broader LogicMonitor team. Finally, the Account Executive must accurately forecast their sales opportunities back to the LogicMonitor Management Team.

Here’s a closer look at your duties in this key role:

  • Identify and prospect into target account
  • Perform Account Executive duties on trial calls as scheduled. Includes understanding the prospects business pain points and product needs
  • Present LogicMonitor value to prospects through conversations, demos, presentations
  • Implement LogicMonitor sales methodology / sales process to move prospects through the sales cycle
  • Assist prospects progress through sales cycle by engaging necessary levels, “multi-threading” and team selling (using SE, management, executive resources as necessary)
  • Trial optimization (proactively adding dashboards, creating sample reports, etc. for all trial prospects)
  • Learn how LogicMonitor solves customer problems, and be able to tailor the solution to various specific scenarios.
  • Identify all technical issues of assigned accounts to assure complete customer satisfaction through all stages of the sales process.

What You’ll Need:

  • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent
  • 3+ years of selling success, preferably selling into IT and/or Enterprise SaaS software
  • Proficiency in oral and written communication skills
  • Strategic and solution sales capabilities that support selling value to business professionals
  • Very strong technical aptitude
Apply for job

items.title: Account Manager
items.content:
Account Manager at Sales Developers

Remote

REMOTE · United States · Client Success

DESCRIPTION

Account Managers act as client advocates and work with internal departments to ensure that client needs are understood and satisfied. They may assist with making sales, handling client complaints, collecting and analyzing data, and improving the overall customer experience.

What you’ll do here…

Act as an outbound sales “expert”

B2B companies call on us as experts in outbound sales strategy and activities. We leverage that expertise, our processes, and the most cutting edge technology to generate outbound sales opportunities on behalf of our clients. The Account Manager role acts as the interface between our internal teams and the client. You, along with a Senior Account Manager, will need to have the confidence and experience to act as an “expert” in all situations that may arise. If you LOVE sales but want to expand your sales skills beyond the front line, this is a role for you.

Coordinate and manage projects in conjunction with Senior Account Manager (SAM)

Each Senior Account Manager may be running 15+ individual accounts. As the account management function coordinates the efforts of several internal departments to produce the best results for our clients, you will assist the SAM in making sure all accounts are on track and following the current processes outlined to ensure client success.

Solve Problems

Ever worked in a company where you elevated ways to improve things but nothing ever happened? That’s not us. You will be empowered and expected to critically analyze our processes and our performance to find efficiencies and better ways of doing things so that we can continue to drive exceptional results for our clients. This might include identifying and elevating process issues, poor client campaign performance, or how we’re communicating internally between teams. This isn’t a “cog in the machine” role – speaking up isn’t just encouraged, it’s required.

Work Remote!

At present, every one of our team members works remotely. We believe this allows people to do their best work and manage their time like professionals, not clock punchers. With tools like Zoom for video calls and Slack for chatting, we’re always in touch and feel like a real team without having to gather around the water cooler to talk (do people still do that?).

Examples of task you might be asked to do on any given day:

  • Pull a report of client activities and determine if anything needs to be elevated to the SAM
  • Attend a weekly client call with the SAM and coordinate after call activities
  • Digest information and produce a Total Addressable Market request for the Data Team
  • Review sales messaging and provide edits and suggestions
  • Work with Data clients to narrow down their Ideal Customer Profile and make sure that any feedback they have is incorporated into their client profile and communicated appropriately to the Data Team.
  • Pull call recordings from an outbound campaign and review for messaging consistency and quality.
  • Research current/new sales messaging frameworks and report back to the team
  • Confirm scheduling procedures for meetings set with the client

REQUIREMENTS

Demonstrable experience and skills required:

  • Professional experience in sales, client service, business development, and/or marketing
  • Proven ability to manage multiple projects at a time while paying strict attention to detail
  • Firm understanding of sales processes and business in general, showing the ability to understand a client’s business model and work with them to reach their sales goals
  • Understanding of modern “data” offerings as it relates to sales. Knowledge of Discover.org, zoom info, and other b2b databases a plus
  • Creative problem solving
  • Previous growth start-up experience a plus
  • Team member mentality
  • Familiarity with the g-suite set of products
  • Willingness to learn
  • Excellent listening, negotiation and presentation skills
  • Ability to prioritize among competing tasks

If any of the below sound like you, this might not be a good fit:

  • You are uncomfortable working in fast-paced, regularly changing environments
  • You avoid or fear conflict
  • You like being told exactly what to do and don’t like to think about how you do things or whythings are being done
  • Working on strategy seems big, nebulous, and not very fun
  • You’re unorganized
  • You prefer to not talk on the phone
  • You’ve never worked remotely before

BENEFITS

  • Competitive pay with clear advancement path
  • The maximum legal health reimbursement plan
  • The best gear, software, and enablement for your work
  • Coaching/mentorship budget
  • Autonomy and the ability to impact the business
  • A challenging and accountable work environment
Apply for job

items.content:
Springpod was born from our desire to transform the way employers engage with students. We empower students to take control of their career path by connecting them with leading employers from the world of science, technology, engineering and maths. From work experience placements to apprenticeships and beyond, we are determined to help students discover their future career – before they leave education. Join us and be part of our mission to revolutionise the way young talent find their dream career.

We’re looking for experienced sales people with hunger, enthusiasm and energy to grow our enterprise customer base. You’ll play a key role in the growth of Springpod and will report into our Commercial Director.

Responsibilities

Research accounts, identify key players, generate interest and develop accounts to create opportunities.
Strategically close high-value business from enterprise clients.
Account management, to drive further revenue from existing enterprise client base
Updating our CRM, managing your own pipeline and reporting back on active deals

Requirements

2-3 years proven sales experience and a track record of success in B2B sales, taking leads from discovery to close
Confidence in selling an innovative technology solution, taking both online demos and face-to-face meetings
Experience in Early in Career Recruitment, TalentTech, B2B Enterprise Sales a must
Experience with deal sizes of £10k – £50k+, and sales cycle taking 1 – 3 months
Experience using HubSpot CRM or Salesforce

Benefits

Fast-paced start-up environment with a lot of responsibility and self-management
Competitive basic salary (30K) and uncapped commission structure (OTE – 50K+)
Very sociable team – fortnightly team meals & weekly drinks at our favourite local pub
Luxury working environment with free fruit, cereal and a great coffee machine
The ability to work remotely some of the time if desired
Training & CPD budget

items.content:
Campusboard is a nationwide marketplace that aims to help the 2.4 million university students in the UK find accommodation, find flatmates and trade unwanted items. One of our main goals is to provide students with an easy and informative way to find private student accommodation for the duration of their studies in the UK.

*THE ROLE*

Your main mission will be working closely with our Chinese language students to help prepare their accommodation options and to provide them with the assistance they require when booking accommodation. This will involve regular conversations with students in the UK & China to ensure all of the requirements for the students are met, and they are able to book their accommodation stress-free and with all the information they need.

The role is flexible and is also open to students who may be looking for work this summer. Remote work is also possible for those not living in London or students who may be travelling during the summer.


*WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:*

* Fluent in Mandarin Chinese both written and verbal.
* Knowledge of Cantonese is a plus, but not required.
* Highly organized, motivated and responsible.
* Stellar communication skills, both written and verbal.
* You can effectively manage your own time and workload.
* Ability to work with a large number of students while maintaining strict attention to detail.
* Prepared to deal with ambiguity present in a startup environment where things evolve quickly.

If you're unsure, please apply – we'd love to hear from you!

items.title: Bid Manager - Remote Part time
items.content:
Mars Spiders is the digital and design agency for public services. We've helped various government departments differently about public services.
Mars Spiders is looking for a brilliantly talented Bid Manager to help us shape and deliver new proposals and tenders for projects. You'll support our sales process, working closely alongside our team of Project Directors and Head of Client Engagement. You'll take part in conversations with prospective senior clients, helping us to turn complex problems and briefs into tangible proposals that we can deliver. You'll have an excellent oversight of the opportunities across government for digital transformation and a thorough understanding of the sector's priorities.
Our company is growing and so is our ambition. We need someone who will provide a creative but focussed approach to our sales process, to help us on our mission to design better public services. We think this role could be the perfect opportunity for a recent graduate of the local government National Graduate Development Programme or similar.
The world as we knew it is gone and with it the big bad expensive ways of delivering government. Now is the time for radical change. For new delivery models but equally new ways of designing our public services, fit for the future not held back by the past.
Sound like a challenge you can help us with? What are you waiting for, please get in touch.
What is the job?
You'll be part of Mars Spiders's operational support team, reporting to our Client Director. You will:
• Work alongside Mars Spiders senior managers and Project Directors, attending meetings and workshops as necessary to support with proposal and bid writing
• Oversee the end to end tender processes - drawing on the skills and resources across the Mars Spiders team to deliver them on time
• Write creative and coherent content for bids, proposals and tender opportunities alongside our team of Project Directors and senior managers
• Track opportunities across the Digital Marketplace and other relevant tender portals, ensuring we're aware of relevant and exciting opportunities for our design team to work on
• Work with the Mars Spiders team to understand our strengths, knowledge, and experience - drawing on this to inform our sales work
• Use your knowledge and insights of our work and the team, to help pitch new ideas or opportunities to Mars Spiders senior managers and project directors
• Keep up to date with trends across the sector, understanding where you feel Mars Spiders should prioritise engagement and business development resource
• Be super detail orientated as well as being comfortable delegating to others in the team
• Provide occasional operational support to Project Directors across our current portfolio of work
• Be interested in all things LocalGov, digital design and delivering better public services!
This isn't a traditional sales manager role. We are looking for somebody who really understands our clients biggest priorities and challenges, and who is passionate about making positive change in public services for users.
What you will bring to Mars Spiders?
• Energy and drive to motivate the team to make sure we have the right tools and assets to help us win important work
• Detail, focus, and rigor to our sales process - making sure we're on track and don't miss out on brilliant opportunities
• Challenge the current ways we do things and influence some of our processes for the better
You might have:
• Worked in or with organisations that design for public impact
Why work at Mars Spiders?
• The opportunity to achieve impact through your work
• Flexible working
• Generous parental leave
• We're collaborative and readily give our time to help others develop
• We hang out together, whether that's at team retreats, summer and Christmas parties, or Friday team breakfasts

The role is a remote home-based but you should be willing to travel

items.title: Utility Sales Executive
items.content:
Utility Sales Executive at EnergyHub

Remote
Utility Sales Executive

EnergyHub is looking for a dynamic Sales Executive with a track record of sales success, strong analytical and communication skills, experience working in the utility market, and passion for the clean energy field. This position will play a critical role and help grow our DERMS business by initiating, developing, and building lasting relationships with utility customers. The Sales Executive will demonstrate domain expertise, thought leadership, command of the sales process, and the ability to develop strong relationships, using these abilities to build a robust pipeline and meet sales targets. Specific responsibilities include:

  • Sell the company’s DERMS software and services to utilities
  • Develop, write, and project manage complex and lengthy RFP responses, including the creation of original content without the support of a proposal-writing team
  • Develop a robust and qualified sales pipeline, communicating progress and results with the rest of the sales team
  • Provide utility prospects with convincing, compelling business cases and arguments to support the value of EnergyHub’s offerings
  • Work closely with utilities to understand current and future utility needs and identify new business opportunities; collaborate with the sales, product and marketing teams to ensure that EnergyHub is building the right products and delivering the right messages to the market
  • Represent EnergyHub at conferences, trade shows, and industry events
Qualifications
  • 3+ years of experience in a business development or sales role in the utility industry, including experience with demand response, energy efficiency, and enterprise SaaS
  • Demonstrated track record of closing high-revenue business opportunities with utility customers
  • Deep industry network and an ability to generate leads independently
  • Excellent written communication, verbal communication, and presentation skill
  • Flexibility for significant amount of travel (20-50%)
  • Location is flexible – Midwest, Southeast, or Mid-Atlantic preferred

EnergyHub is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Location: US Locations Only

Apply for job

items.title: Senior Sales Executive
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
*Role:*
Close monthly SaaS revenue deals by understanding the needs and buying process of prospective corporate partners and demonstrating the value and ROI of the WeGift platform.

*Responsibilities:*
* Working closely with marketing and an incoming SDR to assist in researching, qualifying and accepting sales leads.
* Initiate proactive discovery processes with prospective leads to qualify timing, organisational technical and commercial fit.
* Proactively analyse and evaluate discovery and sales calls to continually improve the sales process, feeding back to the wider team.
* Educate prospective partners on the benefits of digital gift cards, technology as a service and monthly pricing as a commercial model.
* Build ROI calculators and commercials models to assist the partner in their commercial decision.
* Gather key commercial, technical and contractual requirements as part of the closing and onboarding process.
* Working closely with Implementation and Customer Success Managers to assist with successful customer launches
* Evaluating your own process and the wider teams and continually feeding back to iterate and refine the sales process.
* Ensure CRM, sales notes, and reporting data is clean, precise and up to date.

*Requirements:*
* 4-6 years enterprise SaaS or PaaS B2B sales experience.
* Proven track record of selling to mid-market and enterprise customers with minimum contract values of £20k per annum.
* Proven record of delivering month-on-month sales growth, with a decreasing sales cycle and an increasing close rate.

*Compensation*
* £40-60k
* £40-60k annual performance bonus (paid quarterly based on objectives)

*What’s in for you?*
We believe there is a clear distinction between perks and benefits. Perks are easily replicable, whereas benefits are something that are unique to us and something that we have taken the time to think about and tailor to fit our culture and ethos.

*Benefits*
* Pay reviews every 6 months to make sure we’re paying market rate.
* Participation in the Employee Options pool so you get to own a piece of WeGift.
* Pension scheme (3% contribution)
* A minimum of 25 days holiday + bank holidays (we’re not too descriptive about holidays so if you need more time off then just ask).
* Staff perks with WeGift brands - discounts of up to 12% on coffee, weekly groceries, holidays, the list is endless.
* Flexible hours and work from home when needed - yes, yes everyone says this but we do.
* WeRecognise, where we shine the spotlight on exceptional employees every month who in turn get a £200 award in the eGift card of their choice.
* Personal development budget - well actually there is no budget as we don’t believe in putting a cap on learning new things.
* Generous maternity and paternity packages to make sure you get to spend time with your new bundle of joy.
* Fully licensed as a tier 2 sponsor + relocation packages to help you get settled in.

*Perks*
* Brand new We Work office based in Monument, London.
* A new laptop as standard - no one wants an old one when they need to be doing their best work + all the trimmings you need to get the perfect work setup.
* Catered lunch once a week.
* Monthly team socials (Escape Rooms, Karaoke - everyone gets a chance to choose what this looks like)
* Cycle to work scheme - save some £££ on buying a bike


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

items.title: Sales Associate
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
*About MyTutor*

One-to-one tuition is proven to significantly improve pupils’ grades, confidence and life chances. Yet it remains out of reach for many. MyTutor’s mission is to bring *life-changing tuition to all*. Our handpicked network of tutors work online with pupils from all walks of life, and we’ve given over a *quarter of a million lessons* so far – raising results on average by one whole grade. We’re proud of the fact that over *400 schools* have also chosen to work with us. And that we’ve earned a Trustpilot rating of 9.4/10.

We understand the hectic lives of families with teenagers, and our flexible lesson times mean parents can juggle schedules more easily. On our website, it’s simple to find a tutor your child gets on with – and every lesson is tailored to their needs. Also, by having lessons via live video, pupils can access the best tutors no matter where they live or when they need help. No travelling for Mum and Dad, no waiting around, no strangers in your home. Pupils can have their lessons anywhere – at Grandma’s, at a friend’s house or on holiday, so there’s no disruption in the run-up to exams.

Tuition is now more *affordable and accessible*, making life less stressful for busy parents doing their best.


*About the role*


You’ll be joining our passionate, ambitious team in an exciting, fast-paced & high-growth environment. We pride ourselves on an amazing customer experience at MyTutor with over 95% of our reviews at 5* and some great feedback on Trustpilot. As a *Part Time Sales Associate*, you will be responsible for contacting parents and helping them *get started* with a tutor on the platform. No previous experience working in education is necessary; we have amazing in-house specialists and top talent from the industry to train you!


*What you’ll do*


* Contact parents - who have created an account but who have not booked a tutor - via phone, email and live chat
* Pitch our service and help match the parent with a tutor for an introductory Free Meeting
* Build relationships with your leads and advise them on how to get started on MyTutor
* Follow up with previously matched parents and act as an account manager to help them book their first lesson
* Identify opportunities to improve operational efficiency and provide feedback on trends and patterns of parent requests
* Work with the Customer Experience Manager to continuously iterate on communication and processes, to ensure we are providing the best service for parents, and the best results for the business
* Collaborate with the rest of the team to meet targets and support each other
* Work flexible shifts covering a variety of early mornings (7.30am-10am), evenings (5pm-8pm) and weekends (Saturday and Sunday, 9am-12pm and 4pm-7pm)



*Requirements*

* You love the idea of helping parents find the perfect tutor to help their child succeed
* You have previous experience in sales and customer-centric roles
* You’re an excellent communicator who is at ease empathising with customer needs and feels driven to help others
* You’re happy to adapt a sales script to fit each call you make - ensuring that any questions and concerns from parents are addressed
* You’re able to feedback collaboratively and effectively across teams
* You’re comfortable using a laptop/PC and are open to learning how to use our backend sales CMS system
* You are able to work efficiently with the team to achieve team targets, whilst ensuring attention to detail and quality of service


*Benefits*

* Helping to improve the educational outcomes of thousands of young people
* A work atmosphere that encourages collaboration and support
* Opportunity to work autonomously and make use of your creative flair
* Training and investment in your learning
* £10 an hour base rate, with competitive commission based on results
* Team training days and flexible working hours


MyTutor is committed to creating an *inclusive workplace* and have set up our own EDI (Equality, Diversity and Inclusion) committee who host regular events to make sure we live up to those values. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and all applicants will be considered.


*To apply*

Get in touch with your CV and let us know why you’re interested in working with us.

items.title: Account Executive, Group Sales
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Account Executive, Group Sales at Inman News

Remote

Inman News

Anywhere in the U.S.

JOB DESCRIPTION

The real estate community around the world turns to Inman first for accurate, innovative and timely information about the industry. Known for its award-winning journalism, cutting-edge technology coverage and forward-thinking events, Inman is the industry’s leading source of real estate information.

The Account Executive, Group Sales, will primarily sell Inman event tickets to a wide variety of targeted prospective buyers, with a focus on real estate organizations. This position will also play a key role at Inman events, assisting in the operation of sales-related activities for clients and attendees.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Make a high volume of outbound sales calls to prospective Inman event ticket buyers, specifically targeting real estate organizations and those that provide services to real estate professionals
  • Perform grassroots marketing activities to real estate organizations across the country to drive audience development and sales leads
  • Keep accurate CRM records and perform necessary follow up with customers in order to close sales
  • Process orders in Eventbrite and take all necessary steps to complete the sale
  • Assist in the planning and execution of Inman sales elements at Inman events
  • Special projects and assignments as business dictates

KEY SKILLS & KNOWLEDGE

  • 2-3 years prior sales experience (event, group sales, and/or real estate experience a plus)
  • A commanding desire to learn and succeed in sales
  • Cold calling experience with a track record of success
  • The ability to write succinct, crisp emails and a great phone manner
  • com experience a plus
  • A team player, hard-working, passionate, enthusiastic and confident
  • Naturally entrepreneurial and a problem solver
  • Fueled by success with a desire to grow

Inman is an equal opportunity employer committed to building an inclusive workplace environment. This is a full-time, remote position. Our company is 100% distributed so we are seeking candidates from anywhere in the U.S.

Apply for job

items.title: Experienced Marketing and Sales Ghostbloggers Needed
items.content:
Experienced Marketing and Sales Ghostbloggers Needed

Company: Content Conquered
Location: Anywhere
Job Type: Freelance
Description

Seeking intermediate and advanced level sales and marketing ghostbloggers for work on all of the following subjects (among other related topics):

  • SEO
  • Content marketing
  • SEM/PPC
  • Social media marketing (paid and organic)
  • Mobile marketing
  • Conversion rate optimization
  • Referral marketing
  • Marketing automation
  • Ecommerce
  • Growth hacking
  • Sales prospecting
  • Sales outreach
  • Sales strategies/sales technology
  • Startup business

Please include 2-3 relevant writing samples on the topics above (live links preferred).

Please include your hourly rate and/or per-word rate requirements for ghostwritten blogs produced with images (Creative Commons or screenshots) in your bid. Bids without rate requriements will not be considered.

If you have special skills/knowledge/expertise in any of the areas listed above, please make a note in your bid.

Ongoing work available. Freelancers chosen will be expected to sign and abide by Content Conquered's confidentiality agreement.

Native US English speakers only, please (US, UK and AU).

Please apply directly to [email protected] using the subject line "Your Newest Marketing and Sales Writer." Bids without this subject line will not be considered.

Application Instructions
Please apply directly to [email protected] using the subject line "Your Newest Marketing and Sales Writer." Bids without this subject line will not be considered.
